12 Be it known to the king, that the Jews which came up from you to us are come to Jerusalem, building the rebellious and the bad city, and have set up the walls thereof, and joined the foundations.Ezra 4:12
Stats
Counts: 200 characters, 34 words, 158 letters, 62 vowels, 96 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: יְדִ֙יעַ֙ לֶהֱוֵ֣א לְמַלְכָּ֔א דִּ֣י יְהוּדָיֵ֗א דִּ֤י סְלִ֙קוּ֙ מִן־לְוָתָ֔ךְ עֲלֶ֥ינָא אֲתֹ֖ו לִירוּשְׁלֶ֑ם קִרְיְתָ֨א מָֽרָדְתָּ֤א וּבִֽאישְׁתָּא֙ בָּנַ֔יִן [וְשׁוּרַיָּ כ] (וְשׁוּרַיָּ֣א ק) [אֶשְׁכְלִלוּ כ] (שַׁכְלִ֔לוּ ק) וְאֻשַּׁיָּ֖א יַחִֽיטוּ׃

Lit: Known let it be to king the that Jews who came up from you to us have come at Jerusalem city the rebellious and evil and are building and its walls are finishing and foundations the repairing

KJV: Be it known unto the king, that the Jews which came up from thee to us are come unto Jerusalem, building the rebellious and the bad city, and have set up the walls thereof, and joined the foundations.
References

"rebellious"
Ezr 4:15: 19: That search may be made in the book of the records of your fathers: so will you find in the book of the records: and know that this city is a rebellious city: and hurtful to kings and provinces: and that they have moved sedition within the same of old time: for which cause was this city destroyed.
2Ki 18:20: You say: (but they are but vain words: ) I have counsel and strength for the war. Now on whom do you trust: that you rebel against me?
2Ki 24:1: In his days Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon came up: and Jehoiakim became his servant 3 years: then he turned and rebelled against him.
2Ch 36:13: He also rebelled against king Nebuchadnezzar: who had made Him swear by God: but He stiffened His neck: and hardened His heart from turning to the LORD God of Israel.
Jer 52:3: For through the anger of the LORD it came to pass in Jerusalem and Judah: till He had cast them out from His presence: that Zedekiah rebelled against the king of Babylon.
Eze 17:12-21: Say now to the rebellious house: Know you not what these things mean? tell them: Look: the king of Babylon is come to Jerusalem: and has taken the king thereof: and the princes thereof: and led them with him to Babylon;
Lu 23:2-5: They began to accuse Him: saying: We found this fellow perverting the nation: and forbidding to give tribute to Caesar: saying that He Himself is Christ a King.
Ac 24:5: For we have found this man a pestilent fellow: and a mover of sedition among all the Jews throughout the world: and a ringleader of the sect of the Nazarenes:
1Th 5:22: Abstain from all appearance of evil.
1Pe 2:13-15: Submit yourselves to every ordinance of man for the Lord's sake: whether it be to the king: as supreme;

"bad city"
Ps 48:1: 2: and Psalm for the sons of Korah.>> Great is the LORD: and greatly to be praised in the city of our God: in the mountain of His holiness.
Isa 1:21-23: How is the faithful city become an harlot! it was full of judgment; righteousness lodged in it; but now murderers.
Lu 13:34: O Jerusalem: Jerusalem: which kill the prophets: and stone them that are sent to you; how often would I have gathered your children together: as a hen does gather her brood under her wings: and you not would!

"set up"
Ne 1:3: They said to me: The remnant that are left of the captivity there in the province are in great affliction and reproach: the wall of Jerusalem also is broken down: and the gates thereof are burned with fire.
Da 9:25: Know therefore and understand: that from the going forth of the commandment to restore and to build Jerusalem to the Messiah the Prince will be 7 weeks: and threescore and two weeks: the street will be built again: and the wall: even in troublous times.

 כְּעַ֗ן יְדִ֙יעַ֙ לֶהֱוֵ֣א לְמַלְכָּ֔א דִּ֠י הֵ֣ן קִרְיְתָ֥א דָךְ֙ תִּתְבְּנֵ֔א וְשׁוּרַיָּ֖ה יִֽשְׁתַּכְלְל֑וּן מִנְדָּֽה־בְלֹ֤ו וַהֲלָךְ֙ לָ֣א יִנְתְּנ֔וּן וְאַפְּתֹ֥ם מַלְכִ֖ים תְּהַנְזִֽק׃

13 Be it known now to the king, that, if this city be built, and the walls set up again, then will not they pay toll, tribute, and custom, and so you will endamage the revenue of the kings.Ezra 4:13
Stats
Counts: 194 characters, 29 words, 147 letters, 53 vowels, 94 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: כְּעַ֗ן יְדִ֙יעַ֙ לֶהֱוֵ֣א לְמַלְכָּ֔א דִּ֠י הֵ֣ן קִרְיְתָ֥א דָךְ֙ תִּתְבְּנֵ֔א וְשׁוּרַיָּ֖ה יִֽשְׁתַּכְלְל֑וּן מִנְדָּֽה־בְלֹ֤ו וַהֲלָךְ֙ לָ֣א יִנְתְּנ֔וּן וְאַפְּתֹ֥ם מַלְכִ֖ים תְּהַנְזִֽק׃

Lit: Now known let it be to king the that if city this is built and walls the completed tax tribute or custom not they will pay and the treasury of king will be diminished

KJV: Be it known now unto the king, that, if this city be builded, and the walls set up again, then will they not pay toll, tribute, and custom, and [so] thou shalt endamage the revenue of the kings.
References

"if this city"
Ne 5:4: There were also that said: We have borrowed money for the king's tribute: and that upon our lands and vineyards.
Ps 52:2: Your tongue devises mischiefs; like a sharp rasor: working deceitfully.
Ps 119:69: The proud have forged a lie against me: but I will keep your precepts with my whole heart.

"toll"
Ezr 7:24: Also we certify you: that touching any of the priests and Levites: singers: porters: Nethinims: or ministers of this house of God: it will not be lawful to impose toll: tribute: or custom: upon them.
Mt 9:9: As Jesus passed forth from there: He saw a man: named Matthew: sitting at the receipt of custom: and He says to Him: Follow me. And He arose: and followed Him.
Mt 17:25: He says: Yes. And when He was come into the house: Jesus prevented Him: saying: What think you: Simon? of whom do the kings of the earth take custom or tribute? of their own children: or of strangers?
Ro 13:6: 7: For for this cause pay you tribute also: for they are God's ministers: attending continually upon this very thing.

 כְּעַ֗ן כָּל־קֳבֵל֙ דִּֽי־מְלַ֤ח הֵֽיכְלָא֙ מְלַ֔חְנָא וְעַרְוַ֣ת מַלְכָּ֔א לָ֥א אֲ‍ֽרִֽיךְ־לַ֖נָא לְמֶֽחֱזֵ֑א עַ֨ל־דְּנָ֔ה שְׁלַ֖חְנָא וְהֹודַ֥עְנָא לְמַלְכָּֽא׃

14 Now because we have maintenance from the king's palace, and it not was meet for us to see the king's dishonour, therefore have we sent and certified the king;Ezra 4:14
Stats
Counts: 158 characters, 27 words, 125 letters, 51 vowels, 74 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: כְּעַ֗ן כָּל־קֳבֵל֙ דִּֽי־מְלַ֤ח הֵֽיכְלָא֙ מְלַ֔חְנָא וְעַרְוַ֣ת מַלְכָּ֔א לָ֥א אֲ‍ֽרִֽיךְ־לַ֖נָא לְמֶֽחֱזֵ֑א עַ֨ל־דְּנָ֔ה שְׁלַ֖חְנָא וְהֹודַ֥עְנָא לְמַלְכָּֽא׃

Lit: Now all according to because we have maintenance palace from the we receive support and dishonor kings the not it was proper for us to see on account of this we have sent and informed king the

KJV: Now because we have maintenance from the king's palace, and it was not meet for us to see the king's dishonour, therefore have we sent and certified the king;

"and it was"

Joh 12:5: 6: Why not was this ointment sold for 300 pence: and given to the poor?
Joh 19:12-15: From thenceforth Pilate sought to release him: but the Jews cried out: saying: If you let this man go: you are not Caesar's friend: whoever makes himself a king speaks against Caesar.

15 That search may be made in the book of the records of your fathers: so will you find in the book of the records, and know that this city is a rebellious city, and hurtful to kings and provinces, and that they have moved sedition within the same of old time: for which cause was this city destroyed.Ezra 4:15
Stats
Counts: 301 characters, 53 words, 238 letters, 85 vowels, 153 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: דִּ֡י יְבַקַּר֩ בִּֽסְפַר־דָּכְרָ֨נַיָּ֜א דִּ֣י אֲבָהָתָ֗ךְ וּ֠תְהַשְׁכַּח בִּסְפַ֣ר דָּכְרָנַיָּא֮ וְתִנְדַּע֒ דִּי֩ קִרְיְתָ֨א דָ֜ךְ קִרְיָ֣א מָֽרָדָ֗א וּֽמְהַנְזְקַ֤ת מַלְכִין֙ וּמְדִנָ֔ן וְאֶשְׁתַּדּוּר֙ עָבְדִ֣ין בְּגַוַּ֔הּ מִן־יֹומָ֖ת עָלְמָ֑א עַ֨ל־דְּנָ֔ה קִרְיְתָ֥א דָ֖ךְ הָֽחָרְבַֽת׃

Lit: that search may be made in the book of records the of your fathers And you will find in the book of records the and know that city is this a city rebellious and harmful to kings and provinces that sedition they have incited within the city in times former on account of this city this was destroyed

KJV: That search may be made in the book of the records of thy fathers: so shalt thou find in the book of the records, and know that this city is a rebellious city, and hurtful unto kings and provinces, and that they have moved sedition within the same of old time: for which cause was this city destroyed.
References

"this city"
Ezr 4:12: Be it known to the king: that the Jews which came up from you to us are come to Jerusalem: building the rebellious and the bad city: and have set up the walls thereof: and joined the foundations.
Ne 2:19: But when Sanballat the Horonite: and Tobiah the servant: the Ammonite: and Geshem the Arabian: heard it: they laughed us to scorn: and despised us: and said: What is this thing that you do? will you rebel against the king?
Ne 6:6: Wherein was written: It is reported among the heathen: and Gashmu says it: that you and the Jews think to rebel: for which cause you build the wall: that you may be their king: according to these words.
Es 3:5-8: When Haman saw that Mordecai not bowed: nor did him reverence: then was Haman full of wrath.
Da 6:4-13: Then the presidents and princes sought to find occasion against Daniel concerning the kingdom; but they could find none occasion nor fault; forasmuch as he was faithful: neither was there any error or fault found in him.
Ac 17:6: 7: When they found not them: they drew Jason and certain brothers to the rulers of the city: crying: These that have turned the world upside down are come here also;

"for which"
2Ki 24:20: For through the anger of the LORD it came to pass in Jerusalem and Judah: until He had cast them out from His presence: that Zedekiah rebelled against the king of Babylon.
2Ki 25:1: 4: It came to pass in the ninth year of his reign: in the tenth month: in the tenth day of the month: that Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon came: he: and all his host: against Jerusalem: and pitched against it; and they built forts against it round about.
Jer 52:3-34: For through the anger of the LORD it came to pass in Jerusalem and Judah: till He had cast them out from His presence: that Zedekiah rebelled against the king of Babylon.

Hלָֽךְ׃lāḵ.   (Prep | 2ms)

16 We certify the king that, if this city be built again, and the walls thereof set up, by this means you will have no portion on this side the river.Ezra 4:16
Stats
Counts: 151 characters, 27 words, 118 letters, 43 vowels, 75 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: מְהֹודְעִ֤ין אֲנַ֙חְנָה֙ לְמַלְכָּ֔א דִּ֠י הֵ֣ן קִרְיְתָ֥א דָךְ֙ תִּתְבְּנֵ֔א וְשׁוּרַיָּ֖ה יִֽשְׁתַּכְלְל֑וּן לָקֳבֵ֣ל דְּנָ֔ה חֲלָק֙ בַּעֲבַ֣ר נַהֲרָ֔א לָ֥א אִיתַ֖י לָֽךְ׃ פ

Lit: Inform we king the that if city this is rebuilt and its walls are completed the result will be this dominion beyond River the No is for you

KJV: We certify the king that, if this city be builded again, and the walls thereof set up, by this means thou shalt have no portion on this side the river.
References

"thou shalt have"
Ezr 4:20: There have been mighty kings also over Jerusalem: which have ruled over all countries beyond the river; and toll: tribute: and custom: was paid to them.
2Sa 8:3: David smote also Hadadezer: the son of Rehob: king of Zobah: as he went to recover his border at the river Euphrates.
1Ki 4:24: For he had dominion over all the region on this side the river: from Tiphsah even to Azzah: over all the kings on this side the river: and he had peace on all sides round about him.

 פִּתְגָמָ֞א שְׁלַ֣ח מַלְכָּ֗א עַל־רְח֤וּם בְּעֵל־טְעֵם֙ וְשִׁמְשַׁ֣י סָֽפְרָ֔א וּשְׁאָר֙ כְּנָוָ֣תְהֹ֔ון דִּ֥י יָתְבִ֖ין בְּשָֽׁמְרָ֑יִן וּשְׁאָ֧ר עֲבַֽר־נַהֲרָ֛ה שְׁלָ֖ם וּכְעֶֽת׃ ס

H6600פִּתְגָמָ֞אpiṯ-ḡā-mā   (N-msd)

17 Then sent the king an answer to Rehum the chancellor, and to Shimshai the scribe, and to the rest'>rest of their companions that dwell in Samaria, and to the rest'>rest beyond the river, Peace, and at such a time.Ezra 4:17
Stats
Counts: 211 characters, 28 words, 161 letters, 60 vowels, 101 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: פִּתְגָמָ֞א שְׁלַ֣ח מַלְכָּ֗א עַל־רְח֤וּם בְּעֵל־טְעֵם֙ וְשִׁמְשַׁ֣י סָֽפְרָ֔א וּשְׁאָר֙ כְּנָוָ֣תְהֹ֔ון דִּ֥י יָתְבִ֖ין בְּשָֽׁמְרָ֑יִן וּשְׁאָ֧ר עֲבַֽר־נַהֲרָ֛ה שְׁלָ֖ם וּכְעֶֽת׃ ס

Lit: An answer sent king the to Rehum the chancellor the commander and to Shimshai scribe the and to the rest of their companions who dwell in Samaria and to the remainder beyond River the Peace so forth

KJV: Then sent the king an answer unto Rehum the chancellor, and [to] Shimshai the scribe, and [to] the rest of their companions that dwell in Samaria, and [unto] the rest beyond the river, Peace, and at such a time.
References

"companions"
Ezr 4:7: 9: In the days of Artaxerxes wrote Bishlam: Mithredath: Tabeel: and the rest of their companions: to Artaxerxes king of Persia; and the writing of the letter was written in the Syrian tongue: and interpreted in the Syrian tongue.

"Peace"
Ezr 5:7: They sent a letter to him: wherein was written thus; To Darius the king: all peace.
Ezr 7:12: Artaxerxes: king of kings: to Ezra the priest: a scribe of the law of the God of heaven: perfect peace: and at such a time.
Lu 10:5: Into whatever house you enter: first say: Peace be to this house.
Ac 23:26: Claudius Lysias to the most excellent governor Felix sendeth greeting.
Ro 1:7: To all that be in Rome: beloved of God: called to be saints: Grace to you and peace from God our Father: and the Lord Jesus Christ.

"at such a time"
Ezr 4:10: 11: The rest'>rest of the nations whom the great and noble Asnappar brought over: and set in the cities of Samaria: and the rest'>rest that are on this side the river: and at such a time.

18 The letter which you sent to us has been plainly read before me.Ezra 4:18
Stats
Counts: 66 characters, 13 words, 53 letters, 20 vowels, 33 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: נִשְׁתְּוָנָ֕א דִּ֥י שְׁלַחְתּ֖וּן עֲלֶ֑ינָא מְפָרַ֥שׁ קֱרִ֖י קָדָמָֽי׃

Lit: The letter which you sent to us clearly has been read before me

KJV: The letter which ye sent unto us hath been plainly read before me.

Hבַּֽהּ׃bah.   (Prep | 3fs)
 		בַּֽהּ׃bah. in it Prep | 3fs
19 I commanded, and search has been made, and it is found that this city of old time has made insurrection against kings, and that rebellion and sedition have been made therein.Ezra 4:19
Stats
Counts: 180 characters, 29 words, 145 letters, 57 vowels, 88 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וּמִנִּי֮ שִׂ֣ים טְעֵם֒ וּבַקַּ֣רוּ וְהַשְׁכַּ֔חוּ דִּ֚י קִרְיְתָ֣א דָ֔ךְ מִן־יֹומָת֙ עָֽלְמָ֔א עַל־מַלְכִ֖ין מִֽתְנַשְּׂאָ֑ה וּמְרַ֥ד וְאֶשְׁתַּדּ֖וּר מִתְעֲבֶד־בַּֽהּ׃

Lit: And I gave the command A decree and a search has been made and it was found that city this in times former against kings has revolted and rebellion and sedition have been fostered in it

KJV: And I commanded, and search hath been made, and it is found that this city of old time hath made insurrection against kings, and that rebellion and sedition have been made therein.
References

"search"
Ezr 4:15: That search may be made in the book of the records of your fathers: so will you find in the book of the records: and know that this city is a rebellious city: and hurtful to kings and provinces: and that they have moved sedition within the same of old time: for which cause was this city destroyed.
Ezr 5:17: Now therefore: if it seem good to the king: let there be search made in the king's treasure house: which is there at Babylon: whether it be so: that a decree was made of Cyrus the king to build this house of God at Jerusalem: and let the king send His pleasure to us concerning this matter.
Ezr 6:1: 2: Then Darius the king made a decree: and search was made in the house of the rolls: where the treasures were laid up in Babylon.
De 13:14: Then will you inquire: and make search: and ask diligently; and: look: if it be truth: and the thing certain: that such abomination is wrought among you;
Pr 25:2: It is the glory of God to conceal a thing: but the honour of kings is to search out a matter.

"and it is found"
2Ki 18:7: The LORD was with Him; and He prospered wherever He went forth: and He rebelled against the king of Assyria: and served Him not">not Him.
2Ki 24:20: For through the anger of the LORD it came to pass in Jerusalem and Judah: until He had cast them out from His presence: that Zedekiah rebelled against the king of Babylon.

Hלְהֽוֹן׃lə-hō-wn.   (Prep | 3mp)
 		לְהֽוֹן׃lə-hō-wn. to them Prep | 3mp
20 There have been mighty kings also over Jerusalem, which have ruled over all countries beyond the river; and toll, tribute, and custom, was paid to them.Ezra 4:20
Stats
Counts: 154 characters, 21 words, 123 letters, 47 vowels, 76 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וּמַלְכִ֣ין תַּקִּיפִ֗ין הֲוֹו֙ עַל־יְר֣וּשְׁלֶ֔ם וְשַׁ֨לִּיטִ֔ין בְּכֹ֖ל עֲבַ֣ר נַהֲרָ֑ה וּמִדָּ֥ה בְלֹ֛ו וַהֲלָ֖ךְ מִתְיְהֵ֥ב לְהֹֽון׃

Lit: And kings mighty there have been over Jerusalem and who have ruled over all the region beyond River the and tax tribute and custom were paid to them

KJV: There have been mighty kings also over Jerusalem, which have ruled over all countries beyond the river; and toll, tribute, and custom, was paid unto them.
References

"mighty king"
1Ki 4:21: 24: Solomon reigned over all kingdoms from the river to the land of the Philistines: and to the border of Egypt: they brought presents: and served Solomon all the days of his life.
1Ch 18:3: David smote Hadarezer king of Zobah to Hamath: as he went to stablish his dominion by the river Euphrates.
Ps 72:8: He will have dominion also from sea to sea: and from the river to the ends of the earth.

"beyond"
Ezr 4:16: We certify the king that: if this city be built again: and the walls thereof set up: by this means you will have no portion on this side the river.
Ge 15:18: In the same day the LORD made a covenant with Abram: saying: To your seed have I given this land: from the river of Egypt to the great river: the river Euphrates:
Jos 1:3: 4: Every place that the sole of your foot will tread upon: that have I given to you: as I said to Moses.

"toll"
1Ch 18:6: 13: Then David put garrisons in Syriadamascus; and the Syrians became David's servants: and brought gifts. Thus the LORD preserved David wherever He went.
1Ch 19:19: When the servants of Hadarezer saw that they were put to the worse before Israel: they made peace with David: and became his servants: neither would the Syrians help the children of Ammon any more.
2Ch 9:14: 23: 24: Beside that which chapmen and merchants brought. And all the kings of Arabia and governors of the country brought gold and silver to Solomon.
2Ch 17:11: Also some of the Philistines brought Jehoshaphat presents: and tribute silver; and the Arabians brought him flocks: 7700 rams: and 7700 he goats.
2Ch 26:7: 8: God helped Him against the Philistines: and against the Arabians that dwelt in Gurbaal: and the Mehunims.

22 Take heed now that you not fail to do this: why should damage grow to the hurt of the kings?Ezra 4:22
Stats
Counts: 91 characters, 19 words, 70 letters, 25 vowels, 45 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וּזְהִירִ֥ין הֱוֹ֛ו שָׁל֖וּ לְמֶעְבַּ֣ד עַל־דְּנָ֑ה לְמָה֙ יִשְׂגֵּ֣א חֲבָלָ֔א לְהַנְזָקַ֖ת מַלְכִֽין׃ ס

Lit: And heed take that you do not fail to do out this why should increase damage to the hurt of the kings

KJV: Take heed now that ye fail not to do this: why should damage grow to the hurt of the kings?
References

"why should"
Ezr 4:13: Be it known now to the king: that: if this city be built: and the walls set up again: then will not they pay toll: tribute: and custom: and so you will endamage the revenue of the kings.
Es 3:8: 9: Haman said to king Ahasuerus: There is a certain people scattered abroad and dispersed among the people in all the provinces of your kingdom; and their laws are diverse from all people; neither keep they the king's laws: therefore it is not for the king's profit to suffer them.
Es 7:3: 4: Then Esther the queen answered and said: If I have found favour in your sight: O king: and if it please the king: let my life be given me at my petition: and my people at my request:

 אֱדַ֗יִן מִן־דִּ֞י פַּרְשֶׁ֤גֶן נִשְׁתְּוָנָא֙ דִּ֚י [אַרְתַּחְשַׁשְׂתָּא כ] (אַרְתַּחְשַׁ֣שְׂתְּ ק) מַלְכָּ֔א קֱרִ֧י קֳדָם־רְח֛וּם וְשִׁמְשַׁ֥י סָפְרָ֖א וּכְנָוָתְהֹ֑ון אֲזַ֨לוּ בִבְהִיל֤וּ לִירֽוּשְׁלֶם֙ עַל־יְה֣וּדָיֵ֔א וּבַטִּ֥לוּ הִמֹּ֖ו בְּאֶדְרָ֥ע וְחָֽיִל׃ ס

23 Now when the copy of king Artaxerxes' letter was read before Rehum, and Shimshai the scribe, and their companions, they went up in haste to Jerusalem to the Jews, and made them to cease by force and power.Ezra 4:23
Stats
Counts: 207 characters, 33 words, 164 letters, 62 vowels, 102 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: אֱדַ֗יִן מִן־דִּ֞י פַּרְשֶׁ֤גֶן נִשְׁתְּוָנָא֙ דִּ֚י [אַרְתַּחְשַׁשְׂתָּא כ] (אַרְתַּחְשַׁ֣שְׂתְּ ק) מַלְכָּ֔א קֱרִ֧י קֳדָם־רְח֛וּם וְשִׁמְשַׁ֥י סָפְרָ֖א וּכְנָוָתְהֹ֑ון אֲזַ֨לוּ בִבְהִיל֤וּ לִירֽוּשְׁלֶם֙ עַל־יְה֣וּדָיֵ֔א וּבַטִּ֥לוּ הִמֹּ֖ו בְּאֶדְרָ֥ע וְחָֽיִל׃ ס

Lit: then from when the copy of letter which Artaxerxes Artaxerxes King was read before Rehum and Shimshai scribe the and their companions they went up in haste to Jerusalem against Jews and made cease them by force and arms

KJV: Now when the copy of king Artaxerxes' letter was read before Rehum, and Shimshai the scribe, and their companions, they went up in haste to Jerusalem unto the Jews, and made them to cease by force and power.
References

"Rehum"
Ezr 4:8: 9: 17: Rehum the chancellor and Shimshai the scribe wrote a letter against Jerusalem to Artaxerxes the king in this sort:

"they went up"
Pr 4:16: For they not sleep: except they have done mischief; and their sleep is taken away: unless they cause some to fall.
Mic 2:1: Woe to them that devise iniquity: and work evil upon their beds! when the morning is light: they practise it: because it is in the power of their hand.
Ro 3:15: Their feet are swift to shed blood:

24 Then ceased the work of the house of God which is at Jerusalem. So it ceased to the second year of the reign of Darius king of Persia.Ezra 4:24
Stats
Counts: 136 characters, 27 words, 107 letters, 45 vowels, 62 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: בֵּאדַ֗יִן בְּטֵלַת֙ עֲבִידַ֣ת בֵּית־אֱלָהָ֔א דִּ֖י בִּירוּשְׁלֶ֑ם וַהֲוָת֙ בָּֽטְלָ֔א עַ֚ד שְׁנַ֣ת תַּרְתֵּ֔ין לְמַלְכ֖וּת דָּרְיָ֥וֶשׁ מֶֽלֶךְ־פָּרָֽס׃ פ

Lit: Then ceased the work of the house of God which is at Jerusalem And it was discontinued until year two of the reign of Darius king of Persia

KJV: Then ceased the work of the house of God which is at Jerusalem. So it ceased unto the second year of the reign of Darius king of Persia.
References

"So"
Ne 6:3: 9: I sent messengers to them: saying: I am doing a great work: so that I cannot come down: why should the work cease: whilst I leave it: and come down to you?
Job 20:5: That the triumphing of the wicked is short: and the joy of the hypocrite but for a moment?
1Th 2:18: For what reason we would have come to you: even I Paul: once and again; but Satan hindered us.

"Darius"
Ezr 5:5: But the eye of their God was upon the elders of the Jews: that they not could cause them to cease: till the matter came to Darius: and then they returned answer by letter concerning this matter.
Ezr 6:1: Then Darius the king made a decree: and search was made in the house of the rolls: where the treasures were laid up in Babylon.
Hag 1:15: In the 4 and twentieth day of the sixth month: in the second year of Darius the king.

5
Completion of the Temple

Temple Rebuilding Resumes

וְהִתְנַבִּ֞י חַגַּ֣י [נְבִיאָה כ] (נְבִיָּ֗א ק) וּזְכַרְיָ֤ה בַר־עִדֹּוא֙ [נְבִיאַיָּא כ] (נְבִיַּיָּ֔א ק) עַל־יְה֣וּדָיֵ֔א דִּ֥י בִיה֖וּד וּבִירוּשְׁלֶ֑ם בְּשֻׁ֛ם אֱלָ֥הּ יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל עֲלֵיהֹֽון׃ ס

H5922 עַל ʻal al (Aramaic) corresponding to עַל; {above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications}; about, against, concerning, for, (there-) fore, from, in, idiom more, of, (there-, up-) on, (in-) to, phrase why with. 		עֲלֵיהֽוֹן׃‘ă-lê-hō-wn. who was over them Prep | 3mp
1 Then the prophets, Haggai the prophet, and Zechariah the son of Iddo, prophesied to the Jews that were in Judah and Jerusalem in the name of the God of Israel, even to them.Ezra 5:1
Stats
Counts: 179 characters, 28 words, 140 letters, 55 vowels, 85 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וְהִתְנַבִּ֞י חַגַּ֣י [נְבִיאָה כ] (נְבִיָּ֗א ק) וּזְכַרְיָ֤ה בַר־עִדֹּוא֙ [נְבִיאַיָּא כ] (נְבִיַּיָּ֔א ק) עַל־יְה֣וּדָיֵ֔א דִּ֥י בִיה֖וּד וּבִירוּשְׁלֶ֑ם בְּשֻׁ֛ם אֱלָ֥הּ יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל עֲלֵיהֹֽון׃ ס

Lit: And prophesied Haggai prophet the and Zechariah son of Iddo prophets to Jews who were in Judah and Jerusalem in the name of the God of Israel who was over them

KJV: Then the prophets, Haggai the prophet, and Zechariah the son of Iddo, prophesied unto the Jews that were in Judah and Jerusalem in the name of the God of Israel, [even] unto them.
References

"A. M. 3484. B.C. 520. Haggai"
Hag 1:1-15: In the second year of Darius the king: in the sixth month: in the first day of the month: came the word of the LORD by Haggai the prophet to Zerubbabel the son of Shealtiel: governor of Judah: and to Joshua the son of Josedech: the high priest: saying:

"Zechariah"
Zec 1:1-21: In the eighth month: in the second year of Darius: came the word of the LORD to Zechariah: the son of Berechiah: the son of Iddo the prophet: saying:

"in the name"
Mic 5:4: He will stand and feed in the strength of the LORD: in the majesty of the name of the LORD His God; and they will abide: for now will He be great to the ends of the earth.
Hag 1:2-8: Thus speaks the LORD of hosts: saying: This people say: The time not is come: the time that the LORD's house should be built.
Zec 1:3: 4: Therefore say you to them: Thus says the LORD of hosts; Turn you to me: says the LORD of hosts: and I will turn to you: says the LORD of hosts.
Zec 4:6-10: Then He answered and spoke to me: saying: This is the word of the LORD to Zerubbabel: saying: Not by might: nor by power: but by my spirit: says the LORD of hosts.

 בֵּאדַ֡יִן קָ֠מוּ זְרֻבָּבֶ֤ל בַּר־שְׁאַלְתִּיאֵל֙ וְיֵשׁ֣וּעַ בַּר־יֹֽוצָדָ֔ק וְשָׁרִ֣יו לְמִבְנֵ֔א בֵּ֥ית אֱלָהָ֖א דִּ֣י בִירֽוּשְׁלֶ֑ם וְעִמְּהֹ֛ון [נְבִיאַיָּא כ] (נְבִיַּיָּ֥א ק) דִֽי־אֱלָהָ֖א מְסָעֲדִ֥ין לְהֹֽון ׃ פ

Hלְהֽוֹן׃lə-hō-wn   (Prep | 3mp)
 		לְהֽוֹן׃lə-hō-wn them Prep | 3mp
2 Then rose up Zerubbabel the son of Shealtiel, and Jeshua the son of Jozadak, and began to build the house of God which is at Jerusalem: and with them were the prophets of God helping them.Ezra 5:2
Stats
Counts: 190 characters, 31 words, 149 letters, 57 vowels, 92 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: בֵּאדַ֡יִן קָ֠מוּ זְרֻבָּבֶ֤ל בַּר־שְׁאַלְתִּיאֵל֙ וְיֵשׁ֣וּעַ בַּר־יֹֽוצָדָ֔ק וְשָׁרִ֣יו לְמִבְנֵ֔א בֵּ֥ית אֱלָהָ֖א דִּ֣י בִירֽוּשְׁלֶ֑ם וְעִמְּהֹ֛ון [נְבִיאַיָּא כ] (נְבִיַּיָּ֥א ק) דִֽי־אֱלָהָ֖א מְסָעֲדִ֥ין לְהֹֽון ׃ פ

Lit: Then rose up Zerubbabel son of Shealtiel and Jeshua son of Jozadak and began to build the house of God which is in Jerusalem and with them prophets were the of God helping them

KJV: Then rose up Zerubbabel the son of Shealtiel, and Jeshua the son of Jozadak, and began to build the house of God which is at Jerusalem: and with them [were] the prophets of God helping them.
References

"rose up"
Ezr 3:2: Then stood up Jeshua the son of Jozadak: and His brothers the priests: and Zerubbabel the son of Shealtiel: and His brothers: and built the altar of the God of Israel: to offer burnt offerings thereon: as it is written in the law of Moses the man of God.
Hag 1:12-15: Then Zerubbabel the son of Shealtiel: and Joshua the son of Josedech: the high priest: with all the remnant of the people: obeyed the voice of the LORD their God: and the words of Haggai the prophet: as the LORD their God had sent Him: and the people did fear before the LORD.

"Jeshua"

"Joshua, Josedech"

And they built: and finished it: according to the commandment of the God of Israel: and according to the commandment of Cyrus: and Darius: and Artaxerxes king of Persia.

3 At the same time came to them Tatnai, governor on this side the river, and Shetharboznai, and their companions, and said thus to them, Who has commanded you to build this house, and to make up this wall?Ezra 5:3
Stats
Counts: 206 characters, 32 words, 162 letters, 64 vowels, 98 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: בֵּהּ־זִמְנָא֩ אֲתָ֨א עֲלֵיהֹ֜ון תַּ֠תְּנַי פַּחַ֧ת עֲבַֽר־נַהֲרָ֛ה וּשְׁתַ֥ר בֹּוזְנַ֖י וּכְנָוָתְהֹ֑ון וְכֵן֙ אָמְרִ֣ין לְהֹ֔ם מַן־שָׂ֨ם לְכֹ֜ם טְעֵ֗ם בַּיְתָ֤א דְנָה֙ לִבְּנֵ֔א וְאֻשַּׁרְנָ֥א דְנָ֖ה לְשַׁכְלָלָֽה׃ ס

Lit: At same time the came to them Tattenai the governor of the region beyond River the and Shethar-boznai and their companions and thus spoke to them who has commanded you command temple this to build and wall this finish

KJV: At the same time came to them Tatnai, governor on this side the river, and Shetharboznai, and their companions, and said thus unto them, Who hath commanded you to build this house, and to make up this wall?
References

"Tatnai"
Ezr 5:6: The copy of the letter that Tatnai: governor on this side the river: and Shetharboznai: and his companions the Apharsachites: which were on this side the river: sent to Darius the king:
Ezr 6:6: 13: Now therefore: Tatnai: governor beyond the river: Shetharboznai: and your companions the Apharsachites: which are beyond the river: be you far from there:
Ezr 7:21: I: even I Artaxerxes the king: do make a decree to all the treasurers which are beyond the river: that whatever Ezra the priest: the scribe of the law of the God of heaven: will require of you: it be done speedily:
Ne 2:7-9: Moreover I said to the king: If it please the king: let letters be given me to the governors beyond the river: that they may convey me over till I come into Judah;

"Who hath commanded you"
Ezr 5:9: Then asked we those elders: and said to them thus: Who commanded you to build this house: and to make up these walls?
Ezr 1:3: Who is there among you of all His people? His God be with Him: and let Him go up to Jerusalem: which is in Judah: and build the house of the LORD God of Israel: (He is the God: ) which is in Jerusalem.
Mt 21:23: When he was come into the temple: the chief priests and the elders of the people came to him as he was teaching: and said: By what authority do you these things? and who gave you this authority?
Ac 4:7: When they had set them in the middle: they asked: By what power: or by what name: have you done this?

4 Then said we to them after this manner, What are the names of the men that make this building?Ezra 5:4
Stats
Counts: 96 characters, 18 words, 76 letters, 28 vowels, 48 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: אֱדַ֥יִן כְּנֵ֖מָא אֲמַ֣רְנָא לְּהֹ֑ם מַן־אִנּוּן֙ שְׁמָהָ֣ת גֻּבְרַיָּ֔א דִּֽי־דְנָ֥ה בִנְיָנָ֖א בָּנַֽיִן׃

Lit: Then accordingly we told them who were the names of men the who this building were constructing

KJV: Then said we unto them after this manner, What are the names of the men that make this building?

 וְעֵ֣ין אֱלָהֲהֹ֗ם הֲוָת֙ עַל־שָׂבֵ֣י יְהוּדָיֵ֔א וְלָא־בַטִּ֣לוּ הִמֹּ֔ו עַד־טַעְמָ֖א לְדָרְיָ֣וֶשׁ יְהָ֑ךְ וֶאֱדַ֛יִן יְתִיב֥וּן נִשְׁתְּוָנָ֖א עַל־דְּנָֽה׃ פ

5 But the eye of their God was upon the elders of the Jews, that they not could cause them to cease, till the matter came to Darius: and then they returned answer by letter concerning this matter.Ezra 5:5
Stats
Counts: 194 characters, 34 words, 154 letters, 56 vowels, 98 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וְעֵ֣ין אֱלָהֲהֹ֗ם הֲוָת֙ עַל־שָׂבֵ֣י יְהוּדָיֵ֔א וְלָא־בַטִּ֣לוּ הִמֹּ֔ו עַד־טַעְמָ֖א לְדָרְיָ֣וֶשׁ יְהָ֑ךְ וֶאֱדַ֛יִן יְתִיב֥וּן נִשְׁתְּוָנָ֖א עַל־דְּנָֽה׃ פ

Lit: but the eye of their God was upon the elders of Jews so that not they could make cease them till a report to Darius could go and was returned a written answer concerning this matter

KJV: But the eye of their God was upon the elders of the Jews, that they could not cause them to cease, till the matter came to Darius: and then they returned answer by letter concerning this matter.
References

"But the eye"
Ezr 7:6: 28: This Ezra went up from Babylon; and He was a ready scribe in the law of Moses: which the LORD God of Israel had given: and the king granted Him all His request: according to the hand of the LORD His God upon Him.
Ezr 8:22: For I was ashamed to require of the king a band of soldiers and horsemen to help us against the enemy in the way: because we had spoken to the king: saying: The hand of our God is upon all them for good that seek Him; but His power and His wrath is against all them that forsake Him.
2Ch 16:9: For the eyes of the LORD run to and fro throughout the whole earth: to show Himself strong in the behalf of them whose heart is perfect toward Him. Herein you have done foolishly: therefore from henceforth you will have wars.
Ps 32:8: I will instruct you and teach you in the way which you will go: I will guide you with my eye.
Ps 33:18: Look: the eye of the LORD is upon them that fear Him: upon them that hope in His mercy;
Ps 34:15: The eyes of the LORD are upon the righteous: and His ears are open to their cry.
Ps 76:10: Surely the wrath of man will praise you: the remainder of wrath will you restrain.
Php 1:28: not inhing terrified by your adversaries: which is to them an evident token of perdition: but to you of salvation: and that of God.
1Pe 3:12: For the eyes of the Lord are over the righteous: and His ears are open to their prayers: but the face of the Lord is against them that do evil.

"that they"
Ps 129:2-5: Many a time have they afflicted me from my youth: yet they not have prevailed against me.

"then they returned"
Ezr 6:6-12: Now therefore: Tatnai: governor beyond the river: Shetharboznai: and your companions the Apharsachites: which are beyond the river: be you far from there:

Tettenai’s Letter to Darius

פַּרְשֶׁ֣גֶן אִ֠גַּרְתָּא דִּֽי־שְׁלַ֞ח תַּתְּנַ֣י ׀ פַּחַ֣ת עֲבַֽר־נַהֲרָ֗ה וּשְׁתַ֤ר בֹּוזְנַי֙ וּכְנָ֣וָתֵ֔הּ אֲפַ֨רְסְכָיֵ֔א דִּ֖י בַּעֲבַ֣ר נַהֲרָ֑ה עַל־דָּרְיָ֖וֶשׁ מַלְכָּֽא׃

6 The copy of the letter that Tatnai, governor on this side the river, and Shetharboznai, and his companions the Apharsachites, which were on this side the river, sent to Darius the king:Ezra 5:6
Stats
Rank: #5020 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 187 characters, 27 words, 150 letters, 56 vowels, 94 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: פַּרְשֶׁ֣גֶן אִ֠גַּרְתָּא דִּֽי־שְׁלַ֞ח תַּתְּנַ֣י ׀ פַּחַ֣ת עֲבַֽר־נַהֲרָ֗ה וּשְׁתַ֤ר בֹּוזְנַי֙ וּכְנָ֣וָתֵ֔הּ אֲפַ֨רְסְכָיֵ֔א דִּ֖י בַּעֲבַ֣ר נַהֲרָ֑ה עַל־דָּרְיָ֖וֶשׁ מַלְכָּֽא׃

Lit: This is a copy of letter the that sent Tattenai the governor of the region beyond River the and Shethar-boznai and his companions Persians who were in the region beyond River the to Darius king the

KJV: The copy of the letter that Tatnai, governor on this side the river, and Shetharboznai, and his companions the Apharsachites, which were on this side the river, sent unto Darius the king:
References

"Apharsachites"

"Apharsathchites"

7 They sent a letter to him, wherein was written thus; To Darius the king, all peace.Ezra 5:7
Stats
Rank: #6809 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 87 characters, 13 words, 68 letters, 26 vowels, 42 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: פִּתְגָמָ֖א שְׁלַ֣חוּ עֲלֹ֑והִי וְכִדְנָה֙ כְּתִ֣יב בְּגַוֵּ֔הּ לְדָרְיָ֥וֶשׁ מַלְכָּ֖א שְׁלָמָ֥א כֹֽלָּא׃ ס

Lit: A letter they sent to him and this was written in which to Darius king the peace all

KJV: They sent a letter unto him, wherein was written thus; Unto Darius the king, all peace.
References

"all peace"
Ezr 4:17: Then sent the king an answer to Rehum the chancellor: and to Shimshai the scribe: and to the rest'>rest of their companions that dwell in Samaria: and to the rest'>rest beyond the river: Peace: and at such a time.
Da 3:9: They spoke and said to the king Nebuchadnezzar: O king: live for ever.
Da 4:1: Nebuchadnezzar the king: to all people: nations: and languages: that dwell in all the earth; Peace be multiplied to you.
Da 6:21: Then said Daniel to the king: O king: live for ever.
Joh 14:27: Peace I leave with you: my peace I give to you: not as the world gives: give I to you. not Let your heart be troubled: neither let it be afraid.
2Th 3:16: Now the Lord of peace Himself give you peace always by all means. The Lord be with you all.

8 Be it known to the king, that we went into the province of Judea, to the house of the great God, which is built with great stones, and timber is laid in the walls, and this work goes fast on, and prospers in their hands.Ezra 5:8
Stats
Rank: #7907 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 227 characters, 39 words, 176 letters, 64 vowels, 112 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: יְדִ֣יעַ ׀ לֶהֱוֵ֣א לְמַלְכָּ֗א דִּֽי־אֲזַ֜לְנָא לִיה֤וּד מְדִֽינְתָּא֙ לְבֵית֙ אֱלָהָ֣א רַבָּ֔א וְה֤וּא מִתְבְּנֵא֙ אֶ֣בֶן גְּלָ֔ל וְאָ֖ע מִתְּשָׂ֣ם בְּכֻתְלַיָּ֑א וַעֲבִ֥ידְתָּא דָ֛ךְ אָסְפַּ֥רְנָא מִתְעַבְדָ֖א וּמַצְלַ֥ח בְּיֶדְהֹֽם׃ ס

Lit: Known let it be to king the that we went of Judah into province the to the temple of God great the that is being built with stones heavy and timber is being laid in walls the and work this diligently goes on and prospers in their hands

KJV: Be it known unto the king, that we went into the province of Judea, to the house of the great God, which is builded with great stones, and timber is laid in the walls, and this work goeth fast on, and prospereth in their hands.
References

"the province"
Ezr 2:1: Now these are the children of the province that went up out of the captivity: of those which had been carried away: whom Nebuchadnezzar the king of Babylon had carried away to Babylon: and came again to Jerusalem and Judah: every one to his city;
Ne 7:6: These are the children of the province: that went up out of the captivity: of those that had been carried away: whom Nebuchadnezzar the king of Babylon had carried away: and came again to Jerusalem and to Judah: every one to his city;
Ne 11:3: Now these are the chief of the province that dwelt in Jerusalem: but in the cities of Judah dwelt every one in his possession in their cities: to wit: Israel: the priests: and the Levites: and the Nethinims: and the children of Solomon's servants.
Es 1:1: 22: Now it came to pass in the days of Ahasuerus: (this is Ahasuerus which reigned: from India even to Ethiopia: over 107 and 20 provinces:)

"the great God"
Ezr 1:2: 3: Thus says Cyrus king of Persia: The LORD God of heaven has given me all the kingdoms of the earth; and He has charged me to build Him an house at Jerusalem: which is in Judah.
Ezr 6:10: That they may offer sacrifices of sweet savours to the God of heaven: and pray for the life of the king: and of His sons.
Ezr 7:23: Whatever is commanded by the God of heaven: let it be diligently done for the house of the God of heaven: for why should there be wrath against the realm of the king and His sons?
De 10:17: For the LORD your God is God of gods: and Lord of lords: a great God: a mighty: and a terrible: which regards not persons: nor takes reward:
De 32:31: For their rock is not as our Rock: even our enemies themselves being judges.
Ps 145:3: Great is the LORD: and greatly to be praised; and His greatness is unsearchable.
Da 2:47: The king answered to Daniel: and said: Of a truth it is: that your God is a God of gods: and a Lord of kings: and a revealer of secrets: seeing you could reveal this secret.
Da 3:26: Then Nebuchadnezzar came near to the mouth of the burning fiery furnace: and spoke: and said: Shadrach: Meshach: and Abednego: you servants of the most high God: come forth: and come here. Then Shadrach: Meshach: and Abednego: came forth of the middle of the fire.
Da 4:2: 34-37: I thought it good to show the signs and wonders that the high God has wrought toward me.
Da 6:26: I make a decree: That in every dominion of my kingdom men tremble and fear before the God of Daniel: for He is the living God: and stedfast for ever: and His kingdom that which will not be destroyed: and His dominion will be even to the end.

"great stones"
Mr 13:1: 2: As he went out of the temple: one of his disciples says to him: Master: see what manner of stones and what buildings are here!

10 We asked their names also, to certify you, that we might write the names of the men that were the chief of them.Ezra 5:10
Stats
Counts: 113 characters, 21 words, 88 letters, 33 vowels, 55 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וְאַ֧ף שְׁמָהָתְהֹ֛ם שְׁאֵ֥לְנָא לְּהֹ֖ם לְהֹודָעוּתָ֑ךְ דִּ֛י נִכְתֻּ֥ב שֻׁם־גֻּבְרַיָּ֖א דִּ֥י בְרָאשֵׁיהֹֽם׃ ס

Lit: And also their names we asked them to inform you that we might write the names of men the who were chief among them

KJV: We asked their names also, to certify thee, that we might write the names of the men that were the chief of them.

 וּכְנֵ֥מָא פִתְגָמָ֖א הֲתִיב֣וּנָא לְמֵמַ֑ר אֲנַ֣חְנָא הִמֹּ֡ו עַבְדֹוהִי֩ דִֽי־אֱלָ֨הּ שְׁמַיָּ֜א וְאַרְעָ֗א וּבָנַ֤יִן בַּיְתָא֙ דִּֽי־הֲוָ֨א בְנֵ֜ה מִקַּדְמַ֤ת דְּנָה֙ שְׁנִ֣ין שַׂגִּיאָ֔ן וּמֶ֤לֶךְ לְיִשְׂרָאֵל֙ רַ֔ב בְּנָ֖הִי וְשַׁכְלְלֵֽהּ׃

11 Thus they returned us answer, saying, We are the servants of the God of heaven and earth, and build the house that was built these many years ago, which a great king of Israel built and set up.Ezra 5:11
Stats
Counts: 201 characters, 35 words, 158 letters, 61 vowels, 97 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וּכְנֵ֥מָא פִתְגָמָ֖א הֲתִיב֣וּנָא לְמֵמַ֑ר אֲנַ֣חְנָא הִמֹּ֡ו עַבְדֹוהִי֩ דִֽי־אֱלָ֨הּ שְׁמַיָּ֜א וְאַרְעָ֗א וּבָנַ֤יִן בַּיְתָא֙ דִּֽי־הֲוָ֨א בְנֵ֜ה מִקַּדְמַ֤ת דְּנָה֙ שְׁנִ֣ין שַׂגִּיאָ֔ן וּמֶ֤לֶךְ לְיִשְׂרָאֵל֙ רַ֔ב בְּנָ֖הִי וְשַׁכְלְלֵֽהּ׃

Lit: And thus an answer they returned us saying we are the servants of the God of heaven and earth and we are rebuilding temple the that was built ago this is years many and a king of Israel great which built and completed

KJV: And thus they returned us answer, saying, We are the servants of the God of heaven and earth, and build the house that was builded these many years ago, which a great king of Israel builded and set up.
References

"We are"
Jos 24:15: If it seem evil to you to serve the LORD: choose you this day whom you will serve; whether the gods which your fathers served that were on the other side of the flood: or the gods of the Amorites: in whose land you dwell: but as for me and my house: we will serve the LORD.
Ps 119:46: I will speak of your testimonies also before kings: and not will be ashamed.
Da 3:26: Then Nebuchadnezzar came near to the mouth of the burning fiery furnace: and spoke: and said: Shadrach: Meshach: and Abednego: you servants of the most high God: come forth: and come here. Then Shadrach: Meshach: and Abednego: came forth of the middle of the fire.
Jon 1:9: He said to them: I am an Hebrew; and I fear the LORD: the God of heaven: which has made the sea and the dry land.
Mt 10:32: Whoever therefore will confess me before men: Him will I confess also before my Father which is in heaven.
Lu 12:8: Also I say to you: Whoever will confess me before men: Him will the Son of man also confess before the angels of God:
Ac 27:23: For there stood by me this night the angel of God: whose I am: and whom I serve:
Ro 1:16: For I not am ashamed of the gospel of Christ: for it is the power of God to salvation to every one that believes; to the Jew first: and also to the Greek.
Ro 6:16: Know you not: that to whom you yield yourselves servants to obey: his servants you are to whom you obey; whether of sin to death: or of obedience to righteousness?
Ga 6:14: But God forbid that I should glory: save in the cross of our Lord Jesus Christ: by whom the world is crucified to me: and I to the world.

"which a great"

2Ch 3:1-5: Then Solomon began to build the house of the LORD at Jerusalem in mount Moriah: where the LORD appeared to David His father: in the place that David had prepared in the threshingfloor of Ornan the Jebusite.

 לָהֵ֗ן מִן־דִּ֨י הַרְגִּ֤זוּ אֲבָהֳתַ֙נָא֙ לֶאֱלָ֣הּ שְׁמַיָּ֔א יְהַ֣ב הִמֹּ֔ו בְּיַ֛ד נְבוּכַדְנֶצַּ֥ר מֶֽלֶךְ־בָּבֶ֖ל [כַּסְדָּיָא כ] (כַּסְדָּאָ֑ה ק) וּבַיְתָ֤ה דְנָה֙ סַתְרֵ֔הּ וְעַמָּ֖ה הַגְלִ֥י לְבָבֶֽל׃ ס

12 But after that our fathers had provoked the God of heaven to wrath, He gave them into the hand of Nebuchadnezzar the king of Babylon, the Chaldean, who destroyed this house, and carried the people away into Babylon.Ezra 5:12
Stats
Counts: 217 characters, 34 words, 175 letters, 66 vowels, 109 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: לָהֵ֗ן מִן־דִּ֨י הַרְגִּ֤זוּ אֲבָהֳתַ֙נָא֙ לֶאֱלָ֣הּ שְׁמַיָּ֔א יְהַ֣ב הִמֹּ֔ו בְּיַ֛ד נְבוּכַדְנֶצַּ֥ר מֶֽלֶךְ־בָּבֶ֖ל [כַּסְדָּיָא כ] (כַּסְדָּאָ֑ה ק) וּבַיְתָ֤ה דְנָה֙ סַתְרֵ֔הּ וְעַמָּ֖ה הַגְלִ֥י לְבָבֶֽל׃ ס

Lit: But from because provoked to wrath our fathers the God of heaven He gave them into the hand of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon Chaldean the and temple this who destroyed and people the carried away to Babylon

KJV: But after that our fathers had provoked the God of heaven unto wrath, he gave them into the hand of Nebuchadnezzar the king of Babylon, the Chaldean, who destroyed this house, and carried the people away into Babylon.
References

13 But in the first year of Cyrus the king of Babylon the same king Cyrus made a decree to build this house of God.Ezra 5:13
Stats
Counts: 112 characters, 24 words, 88 letters, 33 vowels, 55 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: בְּרַם֙ בִּשְׁנַ֣ת חֲדָ֔ה לְכֹ֥ורֶשׁ מַלְכָּ֖א דִּ֣י בָבֶ֑ל כֹּ֤ורֶשׁ מַלְכָּא֙ שָׂ֣ם טְעֵ֔ם בֵּית־אֱלָהָ֥א דְנָ֖ה לִבְּנֵֽא׃

Lit: However in the year first of Cyrus king of Babylon Cyrus King issued a decree house of God this to build

KJV: But in the first year of Cyrus the king of Babylon the same king Cyrus made a decree to build this house of God.

H7761שָׂמֵֽהּ׃śā-mêh.   (V-Qal-Perf-3ms | 3ms)

14 The vessels also of gold and silver of the house of God, which Nebuchadnezzar took out of the temple that was in Jerusalem, and brought them into the temple of Babylon, those did Cyrus the king take out of the temple of Babylon, and they were delivered to one, whose name was Sheshbazzar, whom He had made governor;Ezra 5:14
Stats
Counts: 325 characters, 50 words, 256 letters, 96 vowels, 160 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וְ֠אַף מָאנַיָּ֣א דִֽי־בֵית־אֱלָהָא֮ דִּ֣י דַהֲבָ֣ה וְכַסְפָּא֒ דִּ֣י נְבוּכַדְנֶצַּ֗ר הַנְפֵּק֙ מִן־הֵֽיכְלָא֙ דִּ֣י בִֽירוּשְׁלֶ֔ם וְהֵיבֵ֣ל הִמֹּ֔ו לְהֵיכְלָ֖א דִּ֣י בָבֶ֑ל הַנְפֵּ֨ק הִמֹּ֜ו כֹּ֣ורֶשׁ מַלְכָּ֗א מִן־הֵֽיכְלָא֙ דִּ֣י בָבֶ֔ל וִיהִ֙יבוּ֙ לְשֵׁשְׁבַּצַּ֣ר שְׁמֵ֔הּ דִּ֥י פֶחָ֖ה שָׂמֵֽהּ׃

Lit: And articles the of house of God the of gold and silver which Nebuchadnezzar had taken from temple the that was in Jerusalem and carried they into temple the of Babylon took those Cyrus King the from temple the of Babylon and they were given to one Sheshbazzar named whom governor he had made

KJV: And the vessels also of gold and silver of the house of God, which Nebuchadnezzar took out of the temple that was in Jerusalem, and brought them into the temple of Babylon, those did Cyrus the king take out of the temple of Babylon, and they were delivered unto [one], whose name [was] Sheshbazzar, whom he had made governor;
References

"the vessels"
Ezr 1:7-10: Also Cyrus the king brought forth the vessels of the house of the LORD: which Nebuchadnezzar had brought forth out of Jerusalem: and had put them in the house of His gods;
Ezr 6:5: Also let the golden and silver vessels of the house of God: which Nebuchadnezzar took forth out of the temple which is at Jerusalem: and brought to Babylon: be restored: and brought again to the temple which is at Jerusalem: every one to His place: and place them in the house of God.
2Ch 36:7: 18: Nebuchadnezzar also carried of the vessels of the house of the LORD to Babylon: and put them in His temple at Babylon.
Jer 52:19: The basons: and the firepans: and the bowls: and the caldrons: and the candlesticks: and the spoons: and the cups; that which was of gold in gold: and that which was of silver in silver: took the captain of the guard away.
Da 5:2: 3: Belshazzar: while he tasted the wine: commanded to bring the golden and silver vessels which his father Nebuchadnezzar had taken out of the temple which was in Jerusalem; that the king: and his princes: his wives: and his concubines: might drink therein.

"the king"
Ezr 7:27: Blessed be the LORD God of our fathers: which has put such a thing as this in the king's heart: to beautify the house of the LORD which is in Jerusalem:
Pr 21:1: The king's heart is in the hand of the LORD: as the rivers of water: He turns it wherever He will.

"Sheshbazzar"
Ezr 5:16: Then came the same Sheshbazzar: and laid the foundation of the house of God which is in Jerusalem: and since that time even until now has it been in building: and yet it not is finished.
Ezr 1:11: All the vessels of gold and of silver were 5400. All these did Sheshbazzar bring up with them of the captivity that were brought up from Babylon to Jerusalem.

"whom"
Hag 1:1: 14: In the second year of Darius the king: in the sixth month: in the first day of the month: came the word of the LORD by Haggai the prophet to Zerubbabel the son of Shealtiel: governor of Judah: and to Joshua the son of Josedech: the high priest: saying:
Hag 2:2: 21: Speak now to Zerubbabel the son of Shealtiel: governor of Judah: and to Joshua the son of Josedech: the high priest: and to the residue of the people: saying:

"governor"
Ac 13:7: 8: 12: Which was with the deputy of the country: Sergius Paulus: a prudent man; who called for Barnabas and Saul: and desired to hear the word of God.

15 Said to Him, Take these vessels, go, carry them into the temple that is in Jerusalem, and let the house of God be built in His place.Ezra 5:15
Stats
Counts: 141 characters, 24 words, 109 letters, 43 vowels, 66 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וַאֲמַר־לֵ֓הּ ׀ [אֵלֶּה כ] (אֵ֚ל ק) מָֽאנַיָּ֔א א אֵֽזֶל־אֲחֵ֣ת הִמֹּ֔ו בְּהֵיכְלָ֖א דִּ֣י בִירוּשְׁלֶ֑ם וּבֵ֥ית אֱלָהָ֖א יִתְבְּנֵ֥א עַל־אַתְרֵֽהּ׃ ס

Lit: And he said to him these these articles take go carry them to temple site the that is in Jerusalem and the house of God let be rebuilt on its former site

KJV: And said unto him, Take these vessels, go, carry them into the temple that is in Jerusalem, and let the house of God be builded in his place.
References

"let the house"
Ezr 1:2: Thus says Cyrus king of Persia: The LORD God of heaven has given me all the kingdoms of the earth; and He has charged me to build Him an house at Jerusalem: which is in Judah.
Ezr 3:3: They set the altar upon His bases; for fear was upon them because of the people of those countries: and they offered burnt offerings thereon to the LORD: even burnt offerings morning and evening.
Ezr 6:3: In the first year of Cyrus the king the same Cyrus the king made a decree concerning the house of God at Jerusalem: Let the house be built: the place where they offered sacrifices: and let the foundations thereof be strongly laid; the height thereof threescore cubits: and the breadth thereof threescore cubits;

H8000שְׁלִֽם׃šə-lim.   (V-Qal-QalPassPrtcpl-ms)
H8000 שְׁלַם shᵉlam shel-am (Aramaic) corresponding to שָׁלַם; to complete, to restore; deliver, finish. 		שְׁלִֽם׃šə-lim. it is finished V-Qal-QalPassPrtcpl-ms
16 Then came the same Sheshbazzar, and laid the foundation of the house of God which is in Jerusalem: and since that time even until now has it been in building, and yet it not is finished.Ezra 5:16
Stats
Counts: 191 characters, 29 words, 148 letters, 59 vowels, 89 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: אֱדַ֙יִן֙ שֵׁשְׁבַּצַּ֣ר דֵּ֔ךְ אֲתָ֗א יְהַ֧ב אֻשַּׁיָּ֛א דִּי־בֵ֥ית אֱלָהָ֖א דִּ֣י בִירוּשְׁלֶ֑ם וּמִן־אֱדַ֧יִן וְעַד־כְּעַ֛ן מִתְבְּנֵ֖א וְלָ֥א שְׁלִֽם׃

Lit: Then Sheshbazzar this came and laid foundation the of the house of God which is in Jerusalem but from then on and even until now it has been under construction and not it is finished

KJV: Then came the same Sheshbazzar, and laid the foundation of the house of God which [is] in Jerusalem: and since that time even until now hath it been in building, and [yet] it is not finished.
References

"laid"
Ezr 5:2: Then rose up Zerubbabel the son of Shealtiel: and Jeshua the son of Jozadak: and began to build the house of God which is at Jerusalem: and with them were the prophets of God helping them.
Ezr 3:8: 10: Now in the second year of their coming to the house of God at Jerusalem: in the second month: began Zerubbabel the son of Shealtiel: and Jeshua the son of Jozadak: and the remnant of their brothers the priests and the Levites: and all they that were come out of the captivity to Jerusalem; and appointed the Levites: from 20 years old and upward: to set forward the work of the house of the LORD.
Hag 1:12-14: Then Zerubbabel the son of Shealtiel: and Joshua the son of Josedech: the high priest: with all the remnant of the people: obeyed the voice of the LORD their God: and the words of Haggai the prophet: as the LORD their God had sent Him: and the people did fear before the LORD.
Hag 2:18: Consider now from this day and upward: from the 4 and twentieth day of the ninth month: even from the day that the foundation of the LORD's temple was laid: consider it.
Zec 4:10: For who has despised the day of small things? for they will rejoice: and will see the plummet in the hand of Zerubbabel with those 7; they are the eyes of the LORD: which run to and fro through the whole earth.

"A. M. 3468-3485. B.C. 536-519. it is not finished"
Ezr 6:15: This house was finished on the third day of the month Adar: which was in the sixth year of the reign of Darius the king.

 וּכְעַ֞ן הֵ֧ן עַל־מַלְכָּ֣א טָ֗ב יִ֠תְבַּקַּר בְּבֵ֨ית גִּנְזַיָּ֜א דִּי־מַלְכָּ֣א תַמָּה֮ דִּ֣י בְּבָבֶל֒ הֵ֣ן אִיתַ֗י דִּֽי־מִן־כֹּ֤ורֶשׁ מַלְכָּא֙ שִׂ֣ים טְעֵ֔ם לְמִבְנֵ֛א בֵּית־אֱלָהָ֥א דֵ֖ךְ בִּירוּשְׁלֶ֑ם וּרְע֥וּת מַלְכָּ֛א עַל־דְּנָ֖ה יִשְׁלַ֥ח עֲלֶֽינָא׃ ס

17 Now therefore, if it seem good to the king, let there be search made in the king's treasure house, which is there at Babylon, whether it be so, that a decree was made of Cyrus the king to build this house of God at Jerusalem, and let the king send His pleasure to us concerning this matter.Ezra 5:17
Stats
Counts: 294 characters, 48 words, 226 letters, 88 vowels, 138 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וּכְעַ֞ן הֵ֧ן עַל־מַלְכָּ֣א טָ֗ב יִ֠תְבַּקַּר בְּבֵ֨ית גִּנְזַיָּ֜א דִּי־מַלְכָּ֣א תַמָּה֮ דִּ֣י בְּבָבֶל֒ הֵ֣ן אִיתַ֗י דִּֽי־מִן־כֹּ֤ורֶשׁ מַלְכָּא֙ שִׂ֣ים טְעֵ֔ם לְמִבְנֵ֛א בֵּית־אֱלָהָ֥א דֵ֖ךְ בִּירוּשְׁלֶ֑ם וּרְע֥וּת מַלְכָּ֛א עַל־דְּנָ֖ה יִשְׁלַ֥ח עֲלֶֽינָא׃ ס

Lit: Now therefore if to king the it seems good let a search be made in house treasure that kings the which is there in Babylon whether it is [so] that by Cyrus King was issued a decree to build house of God this at Jerusalem and his pleasure king the concerning this matter Let send us

KJV: Now therefore, if it seem good to the king, let there be search made in the king's treasure house, which [is] there at Babylon, whether it be [so], that a decree was made of Cyrus the king to build this house of God at Jerusalem, and let the king send his pleasure to us concerning this matter.
References

"A. M. 3485. B.C. 519. let there be"
Ezr 4:15: 19: That search may be made in the book of the records of your fathers: so will you find in the book of the records: and know that this city is a rebellious city: and hurtful to kings and provinces: and that they have moved sedition within the same of old time: for which cause was this city destroyed.
Ezr 6:1: 2: Then Darius the king made a decree: and search was made in the house of the rolls: where the treasures were laid up in Babylon.
Pr 25:2: It is the glory of God to conceal a thing: but the honour of kings is to search out a matter.

"a decree"
Ezr 6:3-5: In the first year of Cyrus the king the same Cyrus the king made a decree concerning the house of God at Jerusalem: Let the house be built: the place where they offered sacrifices: and let the foundations thereof be strongly laid; the height thereof threescore cubits: and the breadth thereof threescore cubits;

6
The Decree of Darius

בֵּאדַ֛יִן דָּרְיָ֥וֶשׁ מַלְכָּ֖א שָׂ֣ם טְעֵ֑ם וּבַקַּ֣רוּ ׀ בְּבֵ֣ית סִפְרַיָּ֗א דִּ֧י גִנְזַיָּ֛א מְהַחֲתִ֥ין תַּמָּ֖ה בְּבָבֶֽל׃

1 Then Darius the king made a decree, and search was made in the house of the rolls, where the treasures were laid up in Babylon.Ezra 6:1
Stats
Rank: #7097 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 127 characters, 23 words, 100 letters, 41 vowels, 59 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: בֵּאדַ֛יִן דָּרְיָ֥וֶשׁ מַלְכָּ֖א שָׂ֣ם טְעֵ֑ם וּבַקַּ֣רוּ ׀ בְּבֵ֣ית סִפְרַיָּ֗א דִּ֧י גִנְזַיָּ֛א מְהַחֲתִ֥ין תַּמָּ֖ה בְּבָבֶֽל׃

Lit: Then Darius King issued a decree and a search was made in archives the where treasures the were stored there in Babylon

KJV: Then Darius the king made a decree, and search was made in the house of the rolls, where the treasures were laid up in Babylon.
References

"and search"
Ezr 4:15: 19: That search may be made in the book of the records of your fathers: so will you find in the book of the records: and know that this city is a rebellious city: and hurtful to kings and provinces: and that they have moved sedition within the same of old time: for which cause was this city destroyed.
Ezr 5:17: Now therefore: if it seem good to the king: let there be search made in the king's treasure house: which is there at Babylon: whether it be so: that a decree was made of Cyrus the king to build this house of God at Jerusalem: and let the king send His pleasure to us concerning this matter.
Job 29:16: I was a father to the poor: and the cause which I not knew I searched out.
Pr 25:2: It is the glory of God to conceal a thing: but the honour of kings is to search out a matter.

"rolls"
Ps 40:7: Then said I: Indeed: I come: in the volume of the book it is written of me:
Jer 36:2-4: 20-23: 29: 32: Take you a roll of a book: and write therein all the words that I have spoken to you against Israel: and against Judah: and against all the nations: from the day I spoke to you: from the days of Josiah: even to this day.
Eze 2:9: When I looked: look: an hand was sent to me; and: indeed: a roll of a book was therein;
Eze 3:1: Moreover He said to me: Son of man: eat that you find; eat this roll: and go speak to the house of Israel.
Re 5:1: I saw in the right hand of him that sat on the throne a book written within and on the backside: sealed with 7 seals.

3 In the first year of Cyrus the king the same Cyrus the king made a decree concerning the house of God at Jerusalem, Let the house be built, the place where they offered sacrifices, and let the foundations thereof be strongly laid; the height thereof threescore cubits, and the breadth thereof threescore cubits;Ezra 6:3
Stats
Counts: 317 characters, 45 words, 255 letters, 97 vowels, 158 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: בִּשְׁנַ֨ת חֲדָ֜ה לְכֹ֣ורֶשׁ מַלְכָּ֗א כֹּ֣ורֶשׁ מַלְכָּא֮ שָׂ֣ם טְעֵם֒ בֵּית־אֱלָהָ֤א בִֽירוּשְׁלֶם֙ בַּיְתָ֣א יִתְבְּנֵ֔א אֲתַר֙ דִּֽי־דָבְחִ֣ין דִּבְחִ֔ין וְאֻשֹּׁ֖והִי מְסֹֽובְלִ֑ין רוּמֵהּ֙ אַמִּ֣ין שִׁתִּ֔ין פְּתָיֵ֖הּ אַמִּ֥ין שִׁתִּֽין׃

Lit: In the year first of Cyrus King Cyrus King issued a decree concerning the house of God at Jerusalem house the let be rebuilt the place where they offered sacrifices and the foundations of it let be firmly laid its height cubits sixty and its width cubits sixty

KJV: In the first year of Cyrus the king the same Cyrus the king made a decree [concerning] the house of God at Jerusalem, Let the house be builded, the place where they offered sacrifices, and let the foundations thereof be strongly laid; the height thereof threescore cubits, [and] the breadth thereof threescore cubits;
References

"the first year"
Ezr 1:1-4: Now in the first year of Cyrus king of Persia: that the word of the LORD by the mouth of Jeremiah might be fulfilled: the LORD stirred up the spirit of Cyrus king of Persia: that He made a proclamation throughout all His kingdom: and put it also in writing: saying:
Ezr 5:13-15: But in the first year of Cyrus the king of Babylon the same king Cyrus made a decree to build this house of God.
2Ch 36:22: 23: Now in the first year of Cyrus king of Persia: that the word of the LORD spoken by the mouth of Jeremiah might be accomplished: the LORD stirred up the spirit of Cyrus king of Persia: that He made a proclamation throughout all His kingdom: and put it also in writing: saying:

"the place"
De 12:5: 6: 11-14: But to the place which the LORD your God will choose out of all your tribes to put His name there: even to His habitation will you seek: and there you will come:
2Ch 2:6: But who is able to build him an house: seeing the heaven and heaven of heavens cannot contain him? who am I then: that I should build him an house: save only to burn sacrifice before him?
Ps 122:4: Whither the tribes go up: the tribes of the LORD: to the testimony of Israel: to give thanks to the name of the LORD.

"the height"
1Ki 6:2: 3: The house which king Solomon built for the LORD: the length thereof was threescore cubits: and the breadth thereof 20 cubits: and the height thereof 30 cubits.
2Ch 3:3: 4: Now these are the things wherein Solomon was instructed for the building of the house of God. The length by cubits after the first measure was threescore cubits: and the breadth 20 cubits.
Eze 41:13-15: So he measured the house: 100 cubits long; and the separate place: and the building: with the walls thereof: 100 cubits long;
Re 21:16: The city lies foursquare: and the length is as large as the breadth: and he measured the city with the reed: 12000 furlongs. The length and the breadth and the height of it are equal.

4 With 3 rows of great stones, and a row of new timber: and let the expences be given out of the king's house:Ezra 6:4
Stats
Counts: 112 characters, 21 words, 86 letters, 33 vowels, 53 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: נִדְבָּכִ֞ין דִּי־אֶ֤בֶן גְּלָל֙ תְּלָתָ֔א וְנִדְבָּ֖ךְ דִּי־אָ֣ע חֲדַ֑ת וְנִ֨פְקְתָ֔א מִן־בֵּ֥ית מַלְכָּ֖א תִּתְיְהִֽב׃

Lit: with rows of stones heavy three and one row of timber New and expenses the from treasury kings the let be paid

KJV: With three rows of great stones, and a row of new timber: and let the expences be given out of the king's house:
References

"three rows"
1Ki 6:36: He built the inner court with 3 rows of hewed stone: and a row of cedar beams.

"the expenses"
Ezr 7:20-23: whatever more will be needful for the house of your God: which you will have occasion to bestow: bestow it out of the king's treasure house.
Ps 68:29: Because of your temple at Jerusalem will kings bring presents to you.
Ps 72:10: The kings of Tarshish and of the isles will bring presents: the kings of Sheba and Seba will offer gifts.
Isa 49:23: Kings will be your nursing fathers: and their queens your nursing mothers: they will bow down to you with their face toward the earth: and lick up the dust of your feet; and you will know that I am the LORD: for they will not be ashamed that wait for me.
Isa 60:6-10: The multitude of camels will cover you: the dromedaries of Midian and Ephah; all they from Sheba will come: they will bring gold and incense; and they will show forth the praises of the LORD.
Re 12:16: The earth helped the woman: and the earth opened her mouth: and swallowed up the flood which the dragon cast out of his mouth.

5 Also let the golden and silver vessels of the house of God, which Nebuchadnezzar took forth out of the temple which is at Jerusalem, and brought to Babylon, be restored, and brought again to the temple which is at Jerusalem, every one to His place, and place them in the house of God.Ezra 6:5
Stats
Counts: 298 characters, 43 words, 232 letters, 89 vowels, 143 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וְ֠אַף מָאנֵ֣י בֵית־אֱלָהָא֮ דִּ֣י דַהֲבָ֣ה וְכַסְפָּא֒ דִּ֣י נְבֽוּכַדְנֶצַּ֗ר הַנְפֵּ֛ק מִן־הֵיכְלָ֥א דִי־בִירוּשְׁלֶ֖ם וְהֵיבֵ֣ל לְבָבֶ֑ל יַהֲתִיב֗וּן וִ֠יהָךְ לְהֵיכְלָ֤א דִי־בִירֽוּשְׁלֶם֙ לְאַתְרֵ֔הּ וְתַחֵ֖ת בְּבֵ֥ית אֱלָהָֽא׃ ס

Lit: And articles of house of God the let gold the and silver which Nebuchadnezzar took from temple the which is in Jerusalem and brought to Babylon be restored and taken back to temple the which is in Jerusalem each to its place and deposit them in house of God the

KJV: And also let the golden and silver vessels of the house of God, which Nebuchadnezzar took forth out of the temple which is at Jerusalem, and brought unto Babylon, be restored, and brought again unto the temple which [is] at Jerusalem, [every one] to his place, and place [them] in the house of God.
References

"the golden"
Ezr 1:7: 8: Also Cyrus the king brought forth the vessels of the house of the LORD: which Nebuchadnezzar had brought forth out of Jerusalem: and had put them in the house of His gods;
Ezr 5:14: The vessels also of gold and silver of the house of God: which Nebuchadnezzar took out of the temple that was in Jerusalem: and brought them into the temple of Babylon: those did Cyrus the king take out of the temple of Babylon: and they were delivered to one: whose name was Sheshbazzar: whom He had made governor;
Jer 27:16: 18-22: Also I spoke to the priests and to all this people: saying: Thus says the LORD; Listen not to the words of your prophets that prophesy to you: saying: Look: the vessels of the LORD's house will now shortly be brought again from Babylon: for they prophesy a lie to you.
Da 1:2: The Lord gave Jehoiakim king of Judah into His hand: with part of the vessels of the house of God: which He carried into the land of Shinar to the house of His god; and He brought the vessels into the treasure house of His god.
Da 5:2: Belshazzar: while he tasted the wine: commanded to bring the golden and silver vessels which his father Nebuchadnezzar had taken out of the temple which was in Jerusalem; that the king: and his princes: his wives: and his concubines: might drink therein.

"which Nebuchadnezzar"
2Ki 24:13: He carried out there all the treasures of the house of the LORD: and the treasures of the king's house: and cut in pieces all the vessels of gold which Solomon king of Israel had made in the temple of the LORD: as the LORD had said.
2Ki 25:14: 15: The pots: and the shovels: and the snuffers: and the spoons: and all the vessels of brass wherewith they ministered: took they away.
2Ch 36:6: 7: 10: 18: Against him came up Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon: and bound him in fetters: to carry him to Babylon.
Jer 52:19: The basons: and the firepans: and the bowls: and the caldrons: and the candlesticks: and the spoons: and the cups; that which was of gold in gold: and that which was of silver in silver: took the captain of the guard away.

 כְּעַ֡ן תַּ֠תְּנַי פַּחַ֨ת עֲבַֽר־נַהֲרָ֜ה שְׁתַ֤ר בֹּוזְנַי֙ וּכְנָוָ֣תְהֹ֔ון אֲפַרְסְכָיֵ֔א דִּ֖י בַּעֲבַ֣ר נַהֲרָ֑ה רַחִיקִ֥ין הֲוֹ֖ו מִן־תַּמָּֽה׃

6 Now therefore, Tatnai, governor beyond the river, Shetharboznai, and your companions the Apharsachites, which are beyond the river, be you far from there:Ezra 6:6
Stats
Counts: 156 characters, 15 words, 125 letters, 48 vowels, 77 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: כְּעַ֡ן תַּ֠תְּנַי פַּחַ֨ת עֲבַֽר־נַהֲרָ֜ה שְׁתַ֤ר בֹּוזְנַי֙ וּכְנָוָ֣תְהֹ֔ון אֲפַרְסְכָיֵ֔א דִּ֖י בַּעֲבַ֣ר נַהֲרָ֑ה רַחִיקִ֥ין הֲוֹ֖ו מִן־תַּמָּֽה׃

Lit: Now therefore Tattenai governor of the region beyond River the and Shethar-boznai and your companions Persians who are beyond River the far keep yourselves from there

KJV: Now therefore, Tatnai, governor beyond the river, Shetharboznai, and your companions the Apharsachites, which [are] beyond the river, be ye far from thence:
References

"Tatnai"
Ezr 5:3: At the same time came to them Tatnai: governor on this side the river: and Shetharboznai: and their companions: and said thus to them: Who has commanded you to build this house: and to make up this wall?

"their societies"
Ezr 5:6: The copy of the letter that Tatnai: governor on this side the river: and Shetharboznai: and his companions the Apharsachites: which were on this side the river: sent to Darius the king:

"be ye far"
Ge 32:28: He said: Your name will be called no more Jacob: but Israel: for as a prince have you power with God and with men: and have prevailed.
Ge 43:14: God Almighty give you mercy before the man: that He may send away your other brother: and Benjamin. If I be bereaved of my children: I am bereaved.
Ne 1:11: O Lord: I beseech you: let now your ear be attentive to the prayer of your servant: and to the prayer of your servants: who desire to fear your name: and prosper: I pray you: your servant this day: and grant Him mercy in the sight of this man. For I was the king's cupbearer.
Ps 76:10: Surely the wrath of man will praise you: the remainder of wrath will you restrain.
Pr 21:1: 30: The king's heart is in the hand of the LORD: as the rivers of water: He turns it wherever He will.
Isa 27:8: In measure: when it shoots forth: you will debate with it: he stays his rough wind in the day of the east wind.
Ac 4:26-28: The kings of the earth stood up: and the rulers were gathered together against the Lord: and against His Christ.
Ro 8:31: What will we then say to these things? If God be for us: who can be against us?

7 Let the work of this house of God alone; let the governor of the Jews and the elders of the Jews build this house of God in His place.Ezra 6:7
Stats
Rank: #3777 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 134 characters, 28 words, 104 letters, 40 vowels, 64 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: שְׁבֻ֕קוּ לַעֲבִידַ֖ת בֵּית־אֱלָהָ֣א דֵ֑ךְ פַּחַ֤ת יְהוּדָיֵא֙ וּלְשָׂבֵ֣י יְהוּדָיֵ֔א בֵּית־אֱלָהָ֥א דֵ֖ךְ יִבְנֹ֥ון עַל־אַתְרֵֽהּ׃

Lit: Let alone the work of house of God this the governor of Jews and the elders of Jews house of God this let build on its site

KJV: Let the work of this house of God alone; let the governor of the Jews and the elders of the Jews build this house of God in his place.

8 Moreover I make a decree what you will do to the elders of these Jews for the building of this house of God: that of the king's goods, even of the tribute beyond the river, forthwith expences be given to these men, that they not be hindered.Ezra 6:8
Stats
Rank: #4517 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 243 characters, 43 words, 191 letters, 73 vowels, 118 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וּמִנִּי֮ שִׂ֣ים טְעֵם֒ לְמָ֣א דִֽי־תַֽעַבְד֗וּן עִם־שָׂבֵ֤י יְהוּדָיֵא֙ אִלֵּ֔ךְ לְמִבְנֵ֖א בֵּית־אֱלָהָ֣א דֵ֑ךְ וּמִנִּכְסֵ֣י מַלְכָּ֗א דִּ֚י מִדַּת֙ עֲבַ֣ר נַהֲרָ֔ה אָסְפַּ֗רְנָא נִפְקְתָ֛א תֶּהֱוֵ֧א מִֽתְיַהֲבָ֛א לְגֻבְרַיָּ֥א אִלֵּ֖ךְ דִּי־לָ֥א לְבַטָּלָֽא׃

Lit: Moreover I issue a decree as to what you shall do for the elders of Jews these for the building of house of God this and at expense kings the from taxes on the region beyond River the diligently cost the let be paid this is to be given to men these so that not they are hindered

KJV: Moreover I make a decree what ye shall do to the elders of these Jews for the building of this house of God: that of the king's goods, even of the tribute beyond the river, forthwith expences be given unto these men, that they be not hindered.
References

"the king's"
Ezr 6:4: With 3 rows of great stones: and a row of new timber: and let the expences be given out of the king's house:
Ezr 4:16: 20: We certify the king that: if this city be built again: and the walls thereof set up: by this means you will have no portion on this side the river.
Ezr 7:15-22: To carry the silver and gold: which the king and His counsellers have freely offered to the God of Israel: whose habitation is in Jerusalem:
Ps 68:29-31: Because of your temple at Jerusalem will kings bring presents to you.
Hag 2:8: The silver is my: and the gold is my: says the LORD of hosts.

"hindered"
Ezr 4:21: 23: Give you now commandment to cause these men to cease: and that this city not be built: until another commandment will be given from me.
Ezr 5:5: But the eye of their God was upon the elders of the Jews: that they not could cause them to cease: till the matter came to Darius: and then they returned answer by letter concerning this matter.

9 That which they have need of, both young bullocks, and rams, and lambs, for the burnt offerings of the God of heaven, wheat, salt, wine, and oil, according to the appointment of the priests which are at Jerusalem, let it be given them day by day without fail:Ezra 6:9
Stats
Rank: #5147 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 263 characters, 39 words, 204 letters, 73 vowels, 131 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וּמָ֣ה חַשְׁחָ֡ן וּבְנֵ֣י תֹורִ֣ין וְדִכְרִ֣ין וְאִמְּרִ֣ין ׀ לַעֲלָוָ֣ן ׀ לֶאֱלָ֪הּ שְׁמַיָּ֟א חִנְטִ֞ין מְלַ֣ח ׀ חֲמַ֣ר וּמְשַׁ֗ח כְּמֵאמַ֨ר כָּהֲנַיָּ֤א דִי־בִירֽוּשְׁלֶם֙ לֶהֱוֵ֨א מִתְיְהֵ֥ב לְהֹ֛ם יֹ֥ום ׀ בְּיֹ֖ום דִּי־לָ֥א שָׁלֽוּ׃

Lit: And what they need and young bulls and rams and lambs for the burnt offerings of the God of heaven wheat salt wine and oil according to the request of priests the who are in Jerusalem let it be given them day by day outside without fail

KJV: And that which they have need of, both young bullocks, and rams, and lambs, for the burnt offerings of the God of heaven, wheat, salt, wine, and oil, according to the appointment of the priests which are at Jerusalem, let it be given them day by day without fail:
References

"young bullocks"
Le 1:3-5: 10: If His offering be a burnt sacrifice of the herd: let Him offer a male without blemish: He will offer it of His own voluntary will at the door of the tabernacle of the congregation before the LORD.
Le 9:2: He said to Aaron: Take you a young calf for a sin offering: and a ram for a burnt offering: without blemish: and offer them before the LORD.
Ps 50:9-13: I will take no bullock out of your house: nor he goats out of your folds.

"lambs"
Ex 29:38-42: Now this is that which you will offer upon the altar; two lambs of the first year day by day continually.
Nu 28:1-29: The LORD spoke to Moses: saying:

"wheat"
Le 2:1-16: When any will offer a meat offering to the LORD: His offering will be of fine flour; and He will pour oil upon it: and put frankincense thereon:
Nu 15:4-31: Then will He that'>He who offers His offering to the LORD bring a meat offering of a tenth deal of flour mingled with the fourth part of an hin of oil.
1Ch 9:29: Some of them also were appointed to oversee the vessels: and all the instruments of the sanctuary: and the fine flour: and the wine: and the oil: and the frankincense: and the spices.

"salt"
Le 2:13: Every oblation of your meat offering will you season with salt; neither will you suffer the salt of the covenant of your God to be lacking from your meat offering: with all your offerings you will offer salt.
Mr 9:49: For every one will be salted with fire: and every sacrifice will be salted with salt.

"let it be given"
Isa 49:23: Kings will be your nursing fathers: and their queens your nursing mothers: they will bow down to you with their face toward the earth: and lick up the dust of your feet; and you will know that I am the LORD: for they will not be ashamed that wait for me.

10 That they may offer sacrifices of sweet savours to the God of heaven, and pray for the life of the king, and of His sons.Ezra 6:10
Stats
Rank: #6060 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 123 characters, 23 words, 96 letters, 36 vowels, 60 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: דִּֽי־לֶהֱוֹ֧ן מְהַקְרְבִ֛ין נִיחֹוחִ֖ין לֶאֱלָ֣הּ שְׁמַיָּ֑א וּמְצַלַּ֕יִן לְחַיֵּ֥י מַלְכָּ֖א וּבְנֹֽוהִי׃

Lit: that they may offer sacrifice of sweet aroma to the God of heaven and pray for the life of king the and his sons

KJV: That they may offer sacrifices of sweet savours unto the God of heaven, and pray for the life of the king, and of his sons.
References

"sweet savours"
Ge 8:21: The LORD smelled a sweet savour; and the LORD said in His heart: I not will again curse the ground any more for man's sake; for the imagination of man's heart is evil from His youth; neither will I again smite any more every thing living: as I have done.
Le 1:9: 13: But His inwards and His legs will He wash in water: and the priest will burn all on the altar: to be a burnt sacrifice: an offering made by fire: of a sweet savour to the LORD.
Eph 5:2: Walk in love: as Christ also has loved us: and has given Himself for us an offering and a sacrifice to God for a sweetsmelling savour.

"pray"
Ezr 7:23: Whatever is commanded by the God of heaven: let it be diligently done for the house of the God of heaven: for why should there be wrath against the realm of the king and His sons?
Jer 29:7: Seek the peace of the city whither I have caused you to be carried away captives: and pray to the LORD for it: for in the peace thereof will you have peace.
1Ti 2:1: 2: I exhort therefore: that: first of all: supplications: prayers: intercessions: and giving of thanks: be made for all men;

11 Also I have made a decree, that whoever will alter this word, let timber be pulled down from his house, and being set up, let him be hanged thereon; and let his house be made a dunghill for this.Ezra 6:11
Stats
Rank: #8412 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 198 characters, 34 words, 154 letters, 60 vowels, 94 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וּמִנִּי֮ שִׂ֣ים טְעֵם֒ דִּ֣י כָל־אֱנָ֗שׁ דִּ֤י יְהַשְׁנֵא֙ פִּתְגָמָ֣א דְנָ֔ה יִתְנְסַ֥ח אָע֙ מִן־בַּיְתֵ֔הּ וּזְקִ֖יף יִתְמְחֵ֣א עֲלֹ֑הִי וּבַיְתֵ֛הּ נְוָל֥וּ יִתְעֲבֵ֖ד עַל־דְּנָֽה׃

Lit: And I issue a decree that any man who alters edict this let be pulled a timber from his house and erected and let him be hanged on it and his house a refuse heap let be made because of this

KJV: Also I have made a decree, that whosoever shall alter this word, let timber be pulled down from his house, and being set up, let him be hanged thereon; and let his house be made a dunghill for this.
References

"whosoever"
Ezr 7:26: whoever not will do the law of your God: and the law of the king: let judgment be executed speedily upon Him: whether it be to death: or to banishment: or to confiscation of goods: or to imprisonment.

"timber"
Es 5:4: Esther answered: If it seem good to the king: let the king and Haman come this day to the banquet that I have prepared for him.
Es 7:10: So they hanged Haman on the gallows that he had prepared for Mordecai. Then was the king's wrath pacified.

"his house"
2Ki 9:37: The carcase of Jezebel will be as dung upon the face of the field in the portion of Jezreel; so that they will not say: This is Jezebel.
2Ki 10:27: They brake down the image of Baal: and brake down the house of Baal: and made it a draught house to this day.
Da 2:5: The king answered and said to the Chaldeans: The thing is gone from me: if you not will make known to me the dream: with the interpretation thereof: you will be cut in pieces: and your houses will be made a dunghill.
Da 3:29: Therefore I make a decree: That every people: nation: and language: which speak any thing amiss against the God of Shadrach: Meshach: and Abednego: will be cut in pieces: and their houses will be made a dunghill: because there is no other God that can deliver after this sort.

 וֵֽאלָהָ֞א דִּ֣י שַׁכִּ֧ן שְׁמֵ֣הּ תַּמָּ֗ה יְמַגַּ֞ר כָּל־מֶ֤לֶךְ וְעַם֙ דִּ֣י ׀ יִשְׁלַ֣ח יְדֵ֗הּ לְהַשְׁנָיָ֛ה לְחַבָּלָ֛ה בֵּית־אֱלָהָ֥א דֵ֖ךְ דִּ֣י בִירוּשְׁלֶ֑ם אֲנָ֤ה דָרְיָ֙וֶשׁ֙ שָׂ֣מֶת טְעֵ֔ם אָסְפַּ֖רְנָא יִתְעֲבִֽד׃ פ
