13 After all that is come upon us for our evil deeds, and for our great trespass, seeing that you our God have punished us less than our iniquities deserve, and have given us such deliverance as this;Ezra 9:13
Stats
Rank: #6904 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 204 characters, 33 words, 161 letters, 66 vowels, 95 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וְאַֽחֲרֵי֙ כָּל־הַבָּ֣א עָלֵ֔ינוּ בְּמַעֲשֵׂ֙ינוּ֙ הָרָעִ֔ים וּבְאַשְׁמָתֵ֖נוּ הַגְּדֹלָ֑ה כִּ֣י ׀ אַתָּ֣ה אֱלֹהֵ֗ינוּ חָשַׂ֤כְתָּֽ לְמַ֙טָּה֙ מֵֽעֲוֹנֵ֔נוּ וְנָתַ֥תָּה לָּ֛נוּ פְּלֵיטָ֖ה כָּזֹֽאת׃

Lit: And after all that has come upon us for our deeds evil for our guilt great since You our God have punished us less than our iniquities deserve and have given us such deliverance as this

KJV: And after all that is come upon us for our evil deeds, and for our great trespass, seeing that thou our God hast punished us less than our iniquities deserve, and hast given us [such] deliverance as this;
References

"after all"
Ne 9:32: Now therefore: our God: the great: the mighty: and the terrible God: who keep covenant and mercy: not let all the trouble seem little before you: that has come upon us: on our kings: on our princes: and on our priests: and on our prophets: and on our fathers: and on all your people: since the time of the kings of Assyria to this day.
Eze 24:13: 14: In your filthiness is lewdness: because I have purged you: and you were not purged: you will not be purged from your filthiness any more: till I have caused my fury to rest upon you.
Ga 3:4: Have you suffered so many things in vain? if it be yet in vain.

"less"
Ps 103:10: He has not dealt with us after our sins; nor rewarded us according to our iniquities.
La 3:22: 39: 40: It is of the LORD's mercies that we not are consumed: because His compassions not fail.
Hab 3:2: O LORD: I have heard your speech: and was afraid: O LORD: revive your work in the middle of the years: in the middle of the years make known; in wrath remember mercy.

"hast given us"
Ps 106:45: 46: He remembered for them his covenant: and repented according to the multitude of his mercies.

 הֲנָשׁוּב֙ לְהָפֵ֣ר מִצְוֹתֶ֔יךָ וּ֨לְהִתְחַתֵּ֔ן בְּעַמֵּ֥י הַתֹּעֵבֹ֖ות הָאֵ֑לֶּה הֲלֹ֤וא תֶֽאֱנַף־בָּ֙נוּ֙ עַד־כַּלֵּ֔ה לְאֵ֥ין שְׁאֵרִ֖ית וּפְלֵיטָֽה׃ פ

14 Should we again break your commandments, and join in affinity with the people of these abominations? would not you be angry with us till you hadst consumed us, so that there should be no remnant nor escaping?Ezra 9:14
Stats
Rank: #7572 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 214 characters, 32 words, 172 letters, 64 vowels, 108 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: הֲנָשׁוּב֙ לְהָפֵ֣ר מִצְוֹתֶ֔יךָ וּ֨לְהִתְחַתֵּ֔ן בְּעַמֵּ֥י הַתֹּעֵבֹ֖ות הָאֵ֑לֶּה הֲלֹ֤וא תֶֽאֱנַף־בָּ֙נוּ֙ עַד־כַּלֵּ֔ה לְאֵ֥ין שְׁאֵרִ֖ית וּפְלֵיטָֽה׃ פ

Lit: should we again break Your commandments and join in marriage with the people committing abominations these would not You be angry with us until You had consumed us so that there would be no remnant or survivor

KJV: Should we again break thy commandments, and join in affinity with the people of these abominations? wouldest not thou be angry with us till thou hadst consumed us, so that [there should be] no remnant nor escaping?
References

"we again"
Joh 5:14: Afterward Jesus findeth Him in the temple: and said to Him: Look: you are made whole: sin no more: lest a worse thing come to you.
Ro 6:1: What will we say then? Will we continue in sin: that grace may abound?
2Pe 2:20: 21: For if after they have escaped the pollutions of the world through the knowledge of the Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ: they are again entangled therein: and overcome: the latter end is worse with them than the beginning.

"join in"
Ezr 9:2: For they have taken of their daughters for themselves: and for their sons: so that the holy seed have mingled themselves with the people of those lands: yes: the hand of the princes and rulers has been chief in this trespass.
Ex 23:32: You will make no covenant with them: nor with their gods.
Jg 2:2: you will make no league with the inhabitants of this land; you will throw down their altars: but you not have obeyed my voice: why have you done this?
Ne 13:23-27: In those days also saw I Jews that had married wives of Ashdod: of Ammon: and of Moab:

"wouldest not thou"
Ex 32:10: Now therefore let me alone: that my wrath may wax hot against them: and that I may consume them: and I will make of you a great nation.
Nu 16:21: 45: Separate yourselves from among this congregation: that I may consume them in a moment.
De 9:8: 14: Also in Horeb you provoked the LORD to wrath: so that the LORD was angry with you to have destroyed you.

"no remnant"
Ezr 9:8: Now for a little space grace has been showed from the LORD our God: to leave us a remnant to escape: and to give us a nail in His holy place: that our God may lighten our eyes: and give us a little reviving in our bondage.
De 32:26: 27: I said: I would scatter them into corners: I would make the remembrance of them to cease from among men:
Isa 1:9: Except the LORD of hosts had left to us a very small remnant: we should have been as Sodom: and we should have been like to Gomorrah.
Jer 46:28: Fear you not: O Jacob my servant: says the LORD: for I am with you; for I will make a full end of all the nations whither I have driven you: but I not will make a full end of you: but correct you in measure; yet will not I leave you wholly unpunished.
Eze 6:8: Yet will I leave a remnant: that you may have some that will escape the sword among the nations: when you will be scattered through the countries.

 יְהוָ֞ה אֱלֹהֵ֤י יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ צַדִּ֣יק אַ֔תָּה כִּֽי־נִשְׁאַ֥רְנוּ פְלֵיטָ֖ה כְּהַיֹּ֣ום הַזֶּ֑ה הִנְנ֤וּ לְפָנֶ֙יךָ֙ בְּאַשְׁמָתֵ֔ינוּ כִּ֣י אֵ֥ין לַעֲמֹ֛וד לְפָנֶ֖יךָ עַל־זֹֽאת׃ פ

H3068יְהוָ֞הYah-weh   (N-proper-ms)
H3068 יְהֹוָה Yᵉhôvâh yeh-ho-vaw from הָיָה; (the) self-Existent or Eternal; Jehovah, Jewish national name of God; Jehovah, the Lord. Compare יָהּ, יְהֹוִה. 		יְהוָ֞הYah-weh Yahweh N-proper-ms
H430אֱלֹהֵ֤י’ĕ-lō-hê   (N-mpc)
H430 אֱלֹהִים ʼĕlôhîym el-o-heem plural of אֱלוֹהַּ; gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative; angels, idiom exceeding, God (gods) (-dess, -ly), idiom (very) great, judges, idiom mighty. 		אֱלֹהֵ֤י’ĕ-lō-hê God N-mpc
H3478יִשְׂרָאֵל֙yiś-rā-’êl   (N-proper-fs)
H3478 יִשְׂרָאֵל Yisrâʼêl yis-raw-ale from שָׂרָה and אֵל; he will rule as God; Jisrael, a symbolical name of Jacob; also (typically) of his posterity; Israel. 		יִשְׂרָאֵל֙yiś-rā-’êl of Israel N-proper-fs

15 O LORD God of Israel, you are righteous: for we remain yet escaped, as it is this day: look, we are before you in our trespasses: for we cannot stand before you because of this.Ezra 9:15
Stats
Rank: #6448 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 186 characters, 25 words, 141 letters, 60 vowels, 81 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: יְהוָ֞ה אֱלֹהֵ֤י יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ צַדִּ֣יק אַ֔תָּה כִּֽי־נִשְׁאַ֥רְנוּ פְלֵיטָ֖ה כְּהַיֹּ֣ום הַזֶּ֑ה הִנְנ֤וּ לְפָנֶ֙יךָ֙ בְּאַשְׁמָתֵ֔ינוּ כִּ֣י אֵ֥ין לַעֲמֹ֛וד לְפָנֶ֖יךָ עַל־זֹֽאת׃ פ

Lit: Yahweh God of Israel righteous You are for we are left as a remnant as it is day this Here we are before You in our guilt though no one can stand before You because of this

KJV: O LORD God of Israel, thou art righteous: for we remain yet escaped, as [it is] this day: behold, we [are] before thee in our trespasses: for we cannot stand before thee because of this.
References

"thou art righteous"
Ne 9:33: 34: Howbeit you are just in all that is brought upon us; for you have done right: but we have done wickedly:
Da 9:7-11: 14: O Lord: righteousness belongeth to you: but to us confusion of faces: as at this day; to the men of Judah: and to the inhabitants of Jerusalem: and to all Israel: that are near: and that are far off: through all the countries whither you have driven them: because of their trespass that they have trespassed against you.
Ro 10:3: For they being ignorant of God's righteousness: and going about to establish their own righteousness: not have submitted themselves to the righteousness of God.

"for we remain"
La 3:22: 23: It is of the LORD's mercies that we not are consumed: because His compassions not fail.

"in our trespasses"
Isa 64:6: 7: But we are all as an unclean thing: and all our righteousnesses are as filthy rags; and we all do fade as a leaf; and our iniquities: like the wind: have taken us away.
Eze 33:10: Therefore: O you son of man: speak to the house of Israel; Thus you speak: saying: If our transgressions and our sins be upon us: and we pine away in them: how should we then live?
Zec 3:3: 4: Now Joshua was clothed with filthy garments: and stood before the angel.
Joh 8:21: 24: Then said Jesus again to them: I go my way: and you will seek me: and will die in your sins: whither I go: you cannot come.
1Co 15:17: If Christ not be raised: your faith is vain; you are yet in your sins.

"we cannot"
Job 9:2: 3: I know it is so of a truth: but how should man be just with God?
Ps 130:3: If you: LORD: should mark iniquities: O Lord: who will stand?
Ps 143:2: not enter into judgment with your servant: for in your sight will no man living be justified.
Ro 3:19: Now we know that what things soever the law says: it says to them who are under the law: that every mouth may be stopped: and all the world may become guilty before God.

10
Shecaniah Encourages Ezra

וּכְהִתְפַּלֵּ֤ל עֶזְרָא֙ וּכְ֨הִתְוַדֹּתֹ֔ו בֹּכֶה֙ וּמִתְנַפֵּ֔ל לִפְנֵ֖י בֵּ֣ית הָאֱלֹהִ֑ים נִקְבְּצוּ֩ אֵלָ֨יו מִיִּשְׂרָאֵ֜ל קָהָ֣ל רַב־מְאֹ֗ד אֲנָשִׁ֤ים וְנָשִׁים֙ וִֽילָדִ֔ים כִּֽי־בָכ֥וּ הָעָ֖ם הַרְבֵּה־בֶֽכֶה׃ ס

H582אֲנָשִׁ֤ים’ă-nā-šîm   (N-mp)
H582 אֱנוֹשׁ ʼĕnôwsh en-oshe from אָנַשׁ; properly, a mortal (and thus differing from the more dignified אָדָם); hence,; a man in general (singly or collectively); another, idiom (blood-) thirsty, certain, chap(-man); divers, fellow, idiom in the flower of their age, husband, (certain, mortal) man, people, person, servant, some (idiom of them), phrase stranger, those, phrase their trade. It is often unexpressed in the English versions, especially when used in apposition with another word. Compare אִישׁ. 		אֲנָשִׁ֤ים’ă-nā-šîm of men N-mp

H3588כִּֽי־kî-   (Conj)
H3588 כִּי kîy kee a primitive particle (the full form of the prepositional prefix) indicating causal relations of all kinds, antecedent or consequent; (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed; and, + (forasmuch, inasmuch, where-) as, assured(-ly), + but, certainly, doubtless, + else, even, + except, for, how, (because, in, so, than) that, + nevertheless, now, rightly, seeing, since, surely, then, therefore, + (al-) though, + till, truly, + until, when, whether, while, whom, yea, yet. 		כִּֽי־kî- for Conj

H1059בֶֽכֶה׃ḇe-ḵeh.   (N-ms)
H1059 בֶּכֶה bekeh beh-keh from בָּכָה; a weeping; idiom sore. 		בֶֽכֶה׃ḇe-ḵeh. bitterly N-ms
1 Now when Ezra had prayed, and when He had confessed, weeping and casting Himself down before the house of God, there assembled to Him out of Israel a very great congregation of men and women and children: for the people wept very sore.Ezra 10:1
Stats
Rank: #8911 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 237 characters, 39 words, 190 letters, 72 vowels, 118 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וּכְהִתְפַּלֵּ֤ל עֶזְרָא֙ וּכְ֨הִתְוַדֹּתֹ֔ו בֹּכֶה֙ וּמִתְנַפֵּ֔ל לִפְנֵ֖י בֵּ֣ית הָאֱלֹהִ֑ים נִקְבְּצוּ֩ אֵלָ֨יו מִיִּשְׂרָאֵ֜ל קָהָ֣ל רַב־מְאֹ֗ד אֲנָשִׁ֤ים וְנָשִׁים֙ וִֽילָדִ֔ים כִּֽי־בָכ֥וּ הָעָ֖ם הַרְבֵּה־בֶֽכֶה׃ ס

Lit: And while was praying Ezra and while he was confessing weeping and bowing down before the house of God gathered to him from Israel a assembly large very of men and women children for wept the people very bitterly

KJV: Now when Ezra had prayed, and when he had confessed, weeping and casting himself down before the house of God, there assembled unto him out of Israel a very great congregation of men and women and children: for the people wept very sore.
References

"when Ezra"
Da 9:3: 4: 20: I set my face to the Lord God: to seek by prayer and supplications: with fasting: and sackcloth: and ashes:
Ac 10:30: Cornelius said: 4 days ago I was fasting until this hour; and at the ninth hour I prayed in my house: and: look: a man stood before me in bright clothing:

"when he had"
Le 26:40: 41: If they will confess their iniquity: and the iniquity of their fathers: with their trespass which they trespassed against me: and that also they have walked contrary to me;
Ps 32:5: I acknowledged my sin to you: and my iniquity have not I hid. I said: I will confess my transgressions to the LORD; and you forgave the iniquity of my sin. Selah.
Ho 14:2: Take with you words: and turn to the LORD: say to Him: Take away all iniquity: and receive us graciously: so will we render the calves of our lips.
1Jo 1:8-10: If we say that we have no sin: we deceive ourselves: and the truth not is in us.

"weeping"
Ps 119:136: Rivers of waters run down my eyes: because they not keep your law.
Jer 9:1: Oh that my head were waters: and my eyes a fountain of tears: that I might weep day and night for the killed of the daughter of my people!
Jer 13:17: But if you not will hear it: my soul will weep in secret places for your pride; and my eye will weep sore: and run down with tears: because the LORD's flock is carried away captive.
Zec 12:10: I will pour upon the house of David: and upon the inhabitants of Jerusalem: the spirit of grace and of supplications: and they will look upon me whom they have pierced: and they will mourn for him: as one mourns for his only son: and will be in bitterness for him: as one that is in bitterness for his firstborn.
Lu 19:41: When he was come near: he beheld the city: and wept over it:
Ro 9:2: That I have great heaviness and continual sorrow in my heart.

"before the house"
1Ki 8:30: listen you to the supplication of your servant: and of your people Israel: when they will pray toward this place: and hear you in heaven your dwelling place: and when you hear: forgive.
1Ki 9:3: The LORD said to Him: I have heard your prayer and your supplication: that you have made before me: I have hallowed this house: which you have built: to put my name there for ever; and my eyes and my heart will be there perpetually.
2Ch 20:9: If: when evil comes upon us: as the sword: judgment: or pestilence: or famine: we stand before this house: and in your presence: (for your name is in this house: ) and cry to you in our affliction: then you will hear and help.

"a very great"
De 31:12: Gather the people together: men: and women: and children: and your stranger that is within your gates: that they may hear: and that they may learn: and fear the LORD your God: and observe to do all the words of this law:
2Ch 20:13: All Judah stood before the LORD: with their little ones: their wives: and their children.
Ne 10:28: The rest of the people: the priests: the Levites: the porters: the singers: the Nethinims: and all they that had separated themselves from the people of the lands to the law of God: their wives: their sons: and their daughters: every one having knowledge: and having understanding;
Joe 2:16-18: Gather the people: sanctify the congregation: assemble the elders: gather the children: and those that suck the breasts: let the groom go forth of his chamber: and the bride out of her closet.
Ac 21:5: When we had accomplished those days: we departed and went our way; and they all brought us on our way: with wives and children: till we were out of the city: and we kneeled down on the shore: and prayed.

"very sore"
Jg 2:4: 5: It came to pass: when the angel of the LORD spoke these words to all the children of Israel: that the people lifted up their voice: and wept.
Ne 8:9: Nehemiah: which is the Tirshatha: and Ezra the priest the scribe: and the Levites that taught the people: said to all the people: This day is holy to the LORD your God; not mourn: nor weep. For all the people wept: when they heard the words of the law.

 וַיַּעַן֩ שְׁכַנְיָ֨ה בֶן־יְחִיאֵ֜ל מִבְּנֵ֤י [עֹולָם כ] (עֵילָם֙ ק) וַיֹּ֣אמֶר לְעֶזְרָ֔א אֲנַ֙חְנוּ֙ מָעַ֣לְנוּ בֵאלֹהֵ֔ינוּ וַנֹּ֛שֶׁב נָשִׁ֥ים נָכְרִיֹּ֖ות מֵעַמֵּ֣י הָאָ֑רֶץ וְעַתָּ֛ה יֵשׁ־מִקְוֶ֥ה לְיִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל עַל־זֹֽאת׃

2 Shechaniah the son of Jehiel, one of the sons of Elam, answered and said to Ezra, We have trespassed against our God, and have taken strange wives of the people of the land: yet now there is hope in Israel concerning this thing.Ezra 10:2

Translation
Hebrew: וַיַּעַן֩ שְׁכַנְיָ֨ה בֶן־יְחִיאֵ֜ל מִבְּנֵ֤י [עֹולָם כ] (עֵילָם֙ ק) וַיֹּ֣אמֶר לְעֶזְרָ֔א אֲנַ֙חְנוּ֙ מָעַ֣לְנוּ בֵאלֹהֵ֔ינוּ וַנֹּ֛שֶׁב נָשִׁ֥ים נָכְרִיֹּ֖ות מֵעַמֵּ֣י הָאָ֑רֶץ וְעַתָּ֛ה יֵשׁ־מִקְוֶ֥ה לְיִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל עַל־זֹֽאת׃

Lit: And spoke up Shechaniah son of Jehiel one of the sons of Elam Elam and said to Ezra we have trespassed against our God and have taken wives pagan from the peoples of the land and yet there is hope in Israel in spite of this

KJV: And Shechaniah the son of Jehiel, one of the sons of Elam, answered and said unto Ezra, We have trespassed against our God, and have taken strange wives of the people of the land: yet now there is hope in Israel concerning this thing.
References

"Shechaniah"
Ezr 10:26: Of the sons of Elam; Mattaniah: Zechariah: and Jehiel: and Abdi: and Jeremoth: and Eliah.
Ne 3:29: After them repaired Zadok the son of Immer over against his house. After him repaired also Shemaiah the son of Shechaniah: the keeper of the east gate.

"Elam"
Ezr 2:7: 31: The children of Elam: a000 254.
Ne 7:12: 34: The children of Elam: a000 254.

"Compare"
Jas 2:9: But if you have respect to persons: you commit sin: and are convinced of the law as transgressors.
Ex 34:12: Take heed to yourself: lest'>lest you make a covenant with the inhabitants of the land whither you go: lest'>lest it be for a snare in the middle of you:
Ne 13:27: Will we then listen to you to do all this great evil: to transgress against our God in marrying strange wives?

"yet now there is hope"
Ex 34:6: 7: The LORD passed by before Him: and proclaimed: The LORD: The LORD God: merciful and gracious: longsuffering: and abundant in goodness and truth:
Isa 55:6: 7: Seek you the LORD while He may be found: call you upon Him while He is near:
Jer 3:12: 13: Go and proclaim these words toward the north: and say: Return: you backsliding Israel: says the LORD; and I not will cause my anger to fall upon you: for I am merciful: says the LORD: and I not will keep anger for ever.
1Jo 1:7-9: But if we walk in the light: as He is in the light: we have fellowship one with another: and the blood of Jesus Christ His Son cleanses us from all sin.

 וְעַתָּ֣ה נִֽכְרָת־בְּרִ֣ית לֵ֠אלֹהֵינוּ לְהֹוצִ֨יא כָל־נָשִׁ֜ים וְהַנֹּולָ֤ד מֵהֶם֙ בַּעֲצַ֣ת אֲדֹנָ֔י וְהַחֲרֵדִ֖ים בְּמִצְוַ֣ת אֱלֹהֵ֑ינוּ וְכַתֹּורָ֖ה יֵעָשֶֽׂה׃

H3772נִֽכְרָת־niḵ-rāṯ-   (V-Qal-Imperf.h-1cp)
H3772 כָּרַת kârath kaw-rath a primitive root; to cut (off, down or asunder); by implication, to destroy or consume; specifically, to covenant (i.e. make an alliance or bargain, originally by cutting flesh and passing between the pieces); be chewed, be con-(feder-) ate, covenant, cut (down, off), destroy, fail, feller, be freed, hew (down), make a league (covenant), idiom lose, perish, idiom utterly, idiom want. 		נִֽכְרָת־niḵ-rāṯ- let us make V-Qal-Imperf.h-1cp

H1285 בְּרִית bᵉrîyth ber-eeth from בָּרָה (in the sense of cutting (like בָּרָא)); a compact (because made by passing between pieces of flesh); confederacy, (con-) feder(-ate), covenant, league. 		בְּרִ֣יתbə-rîṯ a covenant N-fs

H430 אֱלֹהִים ʼĕlôhîym el-o-heem plural of אֱלוֹהַּ; gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative; angels, idiom exceeding, God (gods) (-dess, -ly), idiom (very) great, judges, idiom mighty. 		לֵ֠אלֹהֵינוּlê-lō-hê-nū with our God Prep-l | N-mpc | 1cp

3 Now therefore let us make a covenant with our God to put away all the wives, and such as are born of them, according to the counsel of my lord, and of those that tremble at the commandment of our God; and let it be done according to the law.Ezra 10:3
Stats
Rank: #9942 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 241 characters, 46 words, 187 letters, 71 vowels, 116 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֣ה נִֽכְרָת־בְּרִ֣ית לֵ֠אלֹהֵינוּ לְהֹוצִ֨יא כָל־נָשִׁ֜ים וְהַנֹּולָ֤ד מֵהֶם֙ בַּעֲצַ֣ת אֲדֹנָ֔י וְהַחֲרֵדִ֖ים בְּמִצְוַ֣ת אֱלֹהֵ֑ינוּ וְכַתֹּורָ֖ה יֵעָשֶֽׂה׃

Lit: And therefore let us make a covenant with our God to put away all these wives and those who have been born to them according to the advice of my lord and of those who tremble at the commandment of our God and according to the law let it be done

KJV: Now therefore let us make a covenant with our God to put away all the wives, and such as are born of them, according to the counsel of my lord, and of those that tremble at the commandment of our God; and let it be done according to the law.
References

"let us make"
De 29:12: That you should enter into covenant with the LORD your God: and into His oath: which the LORD your God makes with you this day:
Jos 9:6: They went to Joshua to the camp at Gilgal: and said to him: and to the men of Israel: We be come from a far country: now therefore make you a league with us.
2Ki 11:17: Jehoiada made a covenant between the LORD and the king and the people: that they should be the LORD's people; between the king also and the people.
2Ch 29:10: Now it is in my heart to make a covenant with the LORD God of Israel: that His fierce wrath may turn away from us.
2Ch 34:31: 32: The king stood in His place: and made a covenant before the LORD: to walk after the LORD: and to keep His commandments: and His testimonies: and His statutes: with all His heart: and with all His soul: to perform the words of the covenant which are written in this book.
Ne 9:38: Because of all this we make a sure covenant: and write it; and our princes: Levites: and priests: seal to it.
Ne 10:29-39: They clave to their brothers: their nobles: and entered into a curse: and into an oath: to walk in God's law: which was given by Moses the servant of God: and to observe and do all the commandments of the LORD our Lord: and His judgments and His statutes;

"according to the counsel"
2Ch 30:12: Also in Judah the hand of God was to give them one heart to do the commandment of the king and of the princes: by the word of the LORD.

"of those that"
Ezr 9:4: Then were assembled to me every one that trembled at the words of the God of Israel: because of the transgression of those that had been carried away; and I sat astonied until the evening sacrifice.
2Ch 34:21: 27: Go: inquire of the LORD for me: and for them that are left in Israel and in Judah: concerning the words of the book that is found: for great is the wrath of the LORD that is poured out upon us: because our fathers not have kept the word of the LORD: to do after all that is written in this book.
Ps 119:59: 120: I thought on my ways: and turned my feet to your testimonies.
Isa 66:2: For all those things has my hand made: and all those things have been: says the LORD: but to this man will I look: even to Him that is poor and of a contrite spirit: and trembles at my word.
Eze 9:4: The LORD said to Him: Go through the middle of the city: through the middle of Jerusalem: and set a mark upon the foreheads of the men that sigh and that cry for all the abominations that be done in the middle thereof.

"at the commandment"
De 7:2: 3: When the LORD your God will deliver them before you; you will smite them: and utterly destroy them; you will make no covenant with them: nor show mercy to them:
Jos 23:12: 13: Else if you do in any wise go back: and cleave to the remnant of these nations: even these that remain among you: and will make marriages with them: and go in to them: and they to you:

"let it"
Ne 8:14: They found written in the law which the LORD had commanded by Moses: that the children of Israel should dwell in booths in the feast of the seventh month:
Ne 13:1-3: On that day they read in the book of Moses in the audience of the people; and therein was found written: that the Ammonite and the Moabite not should come into the congregation of God for ever;
Isa 8:20: To the law and to the testimony: if they not speak according to this word: it is because there is no light in them.
1Co 7:12: 13: But to the rest speak I: not the Lord: If any brother has a wife that believes not: and she be pleased to dwell with Him: let Him not">not Him put her away.

H3588כִּֽי־kî-   (Conj)
H3588 כִּי kîy kee a primitive particle (the full form of the prepositional prefix) indicating causal relations of all kinds, antecedent or consequent; (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed; and, + (forasmuch, inasmuch, where-) as, assured(-ly), + but, certainly, doubtless, + else, even, + except, for, how, (because, in, so, than) that, + nevertheless, now, rightly, seeing, since, surely, then, therefore, + (al-) though, + till, truly, + until, when, whether, while, whom, yea, yet. 		כִּֽי־kî- for Conj

4 Arise; for this matter belongeth to you: we also will be with you: be of good courage, and do it.Ezra 10:4
Stats
Counts: 107 characters, 11 words, 77 letters, 33 vowels, 44 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: ק֛וּם כִּֽי־עָלֶ֥יךָ הַדָּבָ֖ר וַאֲנַ֣חְנוּ עִמָּ֑ךְ חֲזַ֖ק וַעֲשֵֽׂה׃ פ

Lit: Arise for your responsibility this matter [is] and we are with you Be of good courage and do it

KJV: Arise; for this matter [belongeth] unto thee: we also [will be] with thee: be of good courage, and do [it].
References

"Arise"
Jos 7:10-26: The LORD said to Joshua: Get you up; for what reason lie you thus upon your face?
1Ch 22:16: 19: Of the gold: the silver: and the brass: and the iron: there is no number. Arise therefore: and be doing: and the LORD be with you.
Ec 9:10: Whatever your hand finds to do: do it with your might; for there is no work: nor device: nor knowledge: nor wisdom: in the grave: whither you go.

"for this matter"
Ezr 7:23-28: Whatever is commanded by the God of heaven: let it be diligently done for the house of the God of heaven: for why should there be wrath against the realm of the king and His sons?
Mr 13:34: For the Son of man is as a man taking a far journey: who left His house: and gave authority to His servants: and to every man His work: and commanded the porter to watch.

"we also will"
Jos 1:16-18: They answered Joshua: saying: All that you command us we will do: and wherever you send us: we will go.
1Ch 28:10: 21: Take heed now; for the LORD has chosen you to build an house for the sanctuary: be strong: and do it.

"be of good"
Isa 35:3: 4: Strengthen you the weak hands: and confirm the feeble knees.
Heb 10:24: Let us consider one another to provoke to love and to good works:
Heb 12:12: 13: For what reason lift up the hands which hang down: and the feeble knees;

 וַיָּ֣קָם עֶזְרָ֡א וַיַּשְׁבַּ֣ע אֶת־שָׂרֵי֩ הַכֹּהֲנִ֨ים הַלְוִיִּ֜ם וְכָל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל לַעֲשֹׂ֛ות כַּדָּבָ֥ר הַזֶּ֖ה וַיִּשָּׁבֵֽעוּ׃

H7650וַיִּשָּׁבֵֽעוּ׃way-yiš-šā-ḇê-‘ū.   (Conj-w | V-Nifal-ConsecImperf-3mp)
H7650 שָׁבַע shâbaʻ shaw-bah a primitive root; properly to be complete, but used only as a denominative from שֶׁבַע; to seven oneself, i.e. swear (as if by repeating a declaration seven times); adjure, charge (by an oath, with an oath), feed to the full (by mistake for שָׂבַע), take an oath, idiom straitly, (cause to, make to) swear., 		וַיִּשָּׁבֵֽעוּ׃way-yiš-šā-ḇê-‘ū. so they swore an oath Conj-w | V-Nifal-ConsecImperf-3mp
5 Then arose Ezra, and made the chief priests, the Levites, and all Israel, to swear that they should do according to this word. And they sware.Ezra 10:5
Stats
Counts: 142 characters, 21 words, 111 letters, 41 vowels, 70 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וַיָּ֣קָם עֶזְרָ֡א וַיַּשְׁבַּ֣ע אֶת־שָׂרֵי֩ הַכֹּהֲנִ֨ים הַלְוִיִּ֜ם וְכָל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל לַעֲשֹׂ֛ות כַּדָּבָ֥ר הַזֶּ֖ה וַיִּשָּׁבֵֽעוּ׃

Lit: And arose Ezra and made swear an oath the leaders of the priests the Levites and all Israel that they would do according to word this so they swore an oath

KJV: Then arose Ezra, and made the chief priests, the Levites, and all Israel, to swear that they should do according to this word. And they sware.
References

"arose"
Pr 1:5: A wise man will hear: and will increase learning; and a man of understanding will attain to wise counsels:
Pr 9:9: Give instruction to a wise man: and he will be yet wiser: teach a just man: and he will increase in learning.
Pr 15:23: A man has joy by the answer of his mouth: and a word spoken in due season: how good is it!
Pr 25:11: 12: A word fitly spoken is like apples of gold in pictures of silver.
Pr 27:9: Ointment and perfume rejoice the heart: so does the sweetness of a man's friend by hearty counsel.

"made"
Ezr 10:3: Now therefore let us make a covenant with our God to put away all the wives: and such as are born of them: according to the counsel of my lord: and of those that tremble at the commandment of our God; and let it be done according to the law.
Ne 5:12: Then said they: We will restore them: and will not requirehing of them; so will we do as you say. Then I called the priests: and took an oath of them: that they should do according to this promise.
Ne 10:29: They clave to their brothers: their nobles: and entered into a curse: and into an oath: to walk in God's law: which was given by Moses the servant of God: and to observe and do all the commandments of the LORD our Lord: and His judgments and His statutes;
Ne 13:25: I contended with them: and cursed them: and smote certain of them: and plucked off their hair: and made them swear by God: saying: You will not give your daughters to their sons: nor take their daughters to your sons: or for yourselves.
Mt 26:63: But Jesus held His peace. And the high priest answered and said to Him: I adjure you by the living God: that you tell us whether you be the Christ: the Son of God.

The People’s Confession of Sin

H3588כִּ֥יkî   (Conj)
H3588 כִּי kîy kee a primitive particle (the full form of the prepositional prefix) indicating causal relations of all kinds, antecedent or consequent; (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed; and, + (forasmuch, inasmuch, where-) as, assured(-ly), + but, certainly, doubtless, + else, even, + except, for, how, (because, in, so, than) that, + nevertheless, now, rightly, seeing, since, surely, then, therefore, + (al-) though, + till, truly, + until, when, whether, while, whom, yea, yet. 		כִּ֥יkî for Conj

H5921עַל־‘al-   (Prep)
H5921 עַל ʻal al properly, the same as עַל used as a preposition (in the singular or plural often with prefix, or as conjunction with a particle following); above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications; above, according to(-ly), after, (as) against, among, and, idiom as, at, because of, beside (the rest of), between, beyond the time, idiom both and, by (reason of), idiom had the charge of, concerning for, in (that), (forth, out) of, (from) (off), (up-) on, over, than, through(-out), to, touching, idiom with., 		עַל־‘al- because Prep

6 Then Ezra rose up from before the house of God, and went into the chamber of Johanan the son of Eliashib: and when He came there, He did eat no bread, nor drink water: for He mourned because of the transgression of them that had been carried away.Ezra 10:6
Stats
Counts: 249 characters, 43 words, 196 letters, 78 vowels, 118 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וַיָּ֣קָם עֶזְרָ֗א מִלִּפְנֵי֙ בֵּ֣ית הָֽאֱלֹהִ֔ים וַיֵּ֕לֶךְ אֶל־לִשְׁכַּ֖ת יְהֹוחָנָ֣ן בֶּן־אֶלְיָשִׁ֑יב וַיֵּ֣לֶךְ שָׁ֗ם לֶ֤חֶם לֹֽא־אָכַל֙ וּמַ֣יִם לֹֽא־שָׁתָ֔ה כִּ֥י מִתְאַבֵּ֖ל עַל־מַ֥עַל הַגֹּולָֽה׃ ס

Lit: And rose up Ezra from before the house of God and went into the chamber of Jehohanan son of Eliashib And when he came there bread no he ate and water no drank for he mourned because of the guilt of those from the captivity

KJV: Then Ezra rose up from before the house of God, and went into the chamber of Johanan the son of Eliashib: and when he came thither, he did eat no bread, nor drink water: for he mourned because of the transgression of them that had been carried away.
References

"the chamber"
Ne 13:5: He had prepared for him a great chamber: where aforetime they laid the meat offerings: the frankincense: and the vessels: and the tithes of the grain: the new wine: and the oil: which was commanded to be given to the Levites: and the singers: and the porters; and the offerings of the priests.

"Johanan"
Ne 3:1: 20: Then Eliashib the high priest rose up with his brothers the priests: and they built the sheep gate; they sanctified it: and set up the doors of it; even to the tower of Meah they sanctified it: to the tower of Hananeel.
Ne 12:10: 22: Jeshua begot Joiakim: Joiakim also begot Eliashib: and Eliashib begot Joiada:
Ne 13:28: one of the sons of Joiada: the son of Eliashib the high priest: was son in law to Sanballat the Horonite: therefore I chased him from me.

"he did eat"
De 9:18: I fell down before the LORD: as at the first: 40 days and 40 nights: I did neither eat bread: nor drink water: because of all your sins which you sinned: in doing wickedly in the sight of the LORD: to provoke Him to anger.
Job 23:12: Neither have I gone back from the commandment of his lips; I have esteemed the words of his mouth more than my necessary food.
Joh 4:31-34: In the mean while his disciples prayed him: saying: Master: eat.

"he mourned"
Ezr 9:4: Then were assembled to me every one that trembled at the words of the God of Israel: because of the transgression of those that had been carried away; and I sat astonied until the evening sacrifice.
Isa 22:12: In that day did the Lord GOD of hosts call to weeping: and to mourning: and to baldness: and to girding with sackcloth:
Da 9:3: I set my face to the Lord God: to seek by prayer and supplications: with fasting: and sackcloth: and ashes:

8 That whoever not would come within 3 days, according to the counsel of the princes and the elders, all his substance should be forfeited, and himself separated from the congregation of those that had been carried away.Ezra 10:8
Stats
Counts: 228 characters, 35 words, 187 letters, 70 vowels, 117 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וְכֹל֩ אֲשֶׁ֨ר לֹֽא־יָבֹ֜וא לִשְׁלֹ֣שֶׁת הַיָּמִ֗ים כַּעֲצַ֤ת הַשָּׂרִים֙ וְהַזְּקֵנִ֔ים יָחֳרַ֖ם כָּל־רְכוּשֹׁ֑ו וְה֥וּא יִבָּדֵ֖ל מִקְּהַ֥ל הַגֹּולָֽה׃ ס

Lit: that whoever not would come within three days according to the instructions of the leaders and elders would be confiscated all his property and he would be separated from the assembly of those from the captivity

KJV: And that whosoever would not come within three days, according to the counsel of the princes and the elders, all his substance should be forfeited, and himself separated from the congregation of those that had been carried away.
References

"And that whosoever"
Ezr 7:26: whoever not will do the law of your God: and the law of the king: let judgment be executed speedily upon Him: whether it be to death: or to banishment: or to confiscation of goods: or to imprisonment.
Jg 21:5: The children of Israel said: Who is there among all the tribes of Israel that not came up with the congregation to the LORD? For they had made a great oath concerning Him that not came up to the LORD to Mizpeh: saying: He will surely be put to death.
1Sa 11:7: He took a yoke of oxen: and hewed them in pieces: and sent them throughout all the coasts of Israel by the hands of messengers: saying: Whoever comes not forth after Saul and after Samuel: so will it be done to His oxen. And the fear of the LORD fell on the people: and they came out with one consent.

"forfeited"
Le 27:28: Notwithstanding no devoted thing: that a man will devote to the LORD of all that He has: both of man and beast: and of the field of His possession: will be sold or redeemed: every devoted thing is most holy to the LORD.
Jos 6:19: But all the silver: and gold: and vessels of brass and iron: are consecrated to the LORD: they will come into the treasury of the LORD.

"himself separated"
Ne 13:3: Now it came to pass: when they had heard the law: that they separated from Israel all the mixed multitude.
Mt 18:17: If he will neglect to hear them: tell it to the church: but if he neglect to hear the church: let him be to you as an heathen man and a publican.
Joh 9:22: 34: These words spoke His parents: because they feared the Jews: for the Jews had agreed already: that if any man did confess that He was Christ: He should be put out of the synagogue.
Joh 16:2: They will put you out of the synagogues: yes: the time comes: that whoever kills you will think that He does God service.
1Co 5:13: But them that are without God judges. Therefore put away from among yourselves that wicked person.

 וַיִּקָּבְצ֣וּ כָל־אַנְשֵֽׁי־יְהוּדָה֩ וּבִנְיָמִ֨ן ׀ יְרוּשָׁלִַ֜ם לִשְׁלֹ֣שֶׁת הַיָּמִ֗ים ה֛וּא חֹ֥דֶשׁ הַתְּשִׁיעִ֖י בְּעֶשְׂרִ֣ים בַּחֹ֑דֶשׁ וַיֵּשְׁב֣וּ כָל־הָעָ֗ם בִּרְחֹוב֙ בֵּ֣ית הָאֱלֹהִ֔ים מַרְעִידִ֥ים עַל־הַדָּבָ֖ר וּמֵהַגְּשָׁמִֽים׃ פ

9 Then all the men of Judah and Benjamin gathered themselves together to Jerusalem within 3 days. It was the ninth month, on the twentieth day of the month; and all the people sat in the street of the house of God, trembling because of this matter, and for the great rain.Ezra 10:9
Stats
Counts: 280 characters, 42 words, 220 letters, 80 vowels, 140 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וַיִּקָּבְצ֣וּ כָל־אַנְשֵֽׁי־יְהוּדָה֩ וּבִנְיָמִ֨ן ׀ יְרוּשָׁלִַ֜ם לִשְׁלֹ֣שֶׁת הַיָּמִ֗ים ה֛וּא חֹ֥דֶשׁ הַתְּשִׁיעִ֖י בְּעֶשְׂרִ֣ים בַּחֹ֑דֶשׁ וַיֵּשְׁב֣וּ כָל־הָעָ֗ם בִּרְחֹוב֙ בֵּ֣ית הָאֱלֹהִ֔ים מַרְעִידִ֥ים עַל־הַדָּבָ֖ר וּמֵהַגְּשָׁמִֽים׃ פ

Lit: So gathered all the men of Judah and Benjamin at Jerusalem within three days It was month the ninth on day twenty of the month and sat all the people in the open square of the house of God trembling because of this matter and because of heavy rain

KJV: Then all the men of Judah and Benjamin gathered themselves together unto Jerusalem within three days. It was the ninth month, on the twentieth [day] of the month; and all the people sat in the street of the house of God, trembling because of [this] matter, and for the great rain.
References

"the ninth month"
Ezr 7:8: 9: He came to Jerusalem in the fifth month: which was in the seventh year of the king.
Es 2:16: So Esther was taken to king Ahasuerus into his house royal in the tenth month: which is the month Tebeth: in the seventh year of his reign.

"trembling"
1Sa 12:17: 18: Is it not wheat harvest today? I will call to the LORD: and He will send thunder and rain; that you may perceive and see that your wickedness is great: which you have done in the sight of the LORD: in asking you a king.
Jer 10:10: 13: But the LORD is the true God: He is the living God: and an everlasting king: at His wrath the earth will tremble: and the nations will not be able to abide His indignation.

 וַיָּ֨קָם עֶזְרָ֤א הַכֹּהֵן֙ וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֲלֵהֶ֔ם אַתֶּ֣ם מְעַלְתֶּ֔ם וַתֹּשִׁ֖יבוּ נָשִׁ֣ים נָכְרִיֹּ֑ות לְהֹוסִ֖יף עַל־אַשְׁמַ֥ת יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃

10 Ezra the priest stood up, and said to them, You have transgressed, and have taken strange wives, to increase the trespass of Israel.Ezra 10:10
Stats
Counts: 137 characters, 20 words, 109 letters, 42 vowels, 67 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וַיָּ֨קָם עֶזְרָ֤א הַכֹּהֵן֙ וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֲלֵהֶ֔ם אַתֶּ֣ם מְעַלְתֶּ֔ם וַתֹּשִׁ֖יבוּ נָשִׁ֣ים נָכְרִיֹּ֑ות לְהֹוסִ֖יף עַל־אַשְׁמַ֥ת יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃

Lit: And stood up Ezra the priest and said to them You have transgressed and have taken wives pagan adding to the guilt of Israel

KJV: And Ezra the priest stood up, and said unto them, Ye have transgressed, and have taken strange wives, to increase the trespass of Israel.

"taken"

Jos 22:17: 18: Is the iniquity of Peor too little for us: from which we not are cleansed until this day: although there was a plague in the congregation of the LORD:
2Ch 28:13: Said to them: You will not bring in the captives here: for whereas we have offended against the LORD already: you intend to add more to our sins and to our trespass: for our trespass is great: and there is fierce wrath against Israel.
Mt 23:32: Fill you up then the measure of your fathers.

11 Now therefore make confession to the LORD God of your fathers, and do His pleasure: and separate yourselves from the people of the land, and from the strange wives.Ezra 10:11
Stats
Rank: #4256 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 166 characters, 26 words, 134 letters, 52 vowels, 82 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֗ה תְּנ֥וּ תֹודָ֛ה לַיהוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֵֽי־אֲבֹתֵיכֶ֖ם וַעֲשׂ֣וּ רְצֹונֹ֑ו וְהִבָּֽדְלוּ֙ מֵעַמֵּ֣י הָאָ֔רֶץ וּמִן־הַנָּשִׁ֖ים הַנָּכְרִיֹּֽות׃

Lit: Now therefore make confession to Yahweh God of your fathers and do His will and separate yourselves from the peoples of the land and from the wives pagan

KJV: Now therefore make confession unto the LORD God of your fathers, and do his pleasure: and separate yourselves from the people of the land, and from the strange wives.
References

"make confession"
Le 26:40-42: If they will confess their iniquity: and the iniquity of their fathers: with their trespass which they trespassed against me: and that also they have walked contrary to me;
Jos 7:19: Joshua said to Achan: My son: give: I pray you: glory to the LORD God of Israel: and make confession to Him; and tell me now what you have done; hide it not from me.
Ps 32:5: I acknowledged my sin to you: and my iniquity have not I hid. I said: I will confess my transgressions to the LORD; and you forgave the iniquity of my sin. Selah.
Pr 28:13: He who covers his sins will not prosper: but whoever confesss and forsakes them will have mercy.
Jer 3:13: Only acknowledge your iniquity: that you have transgressed against the LORD your God: and have scattered your ways to the strangers under every green tree: and you not have obeyed my voice: says the LORD.
1Jo 1:7-9: But if we walk in the light: as He is in the light: we have fellowship one with another: and the blood of Jesus Christ His Son cleanses us from all sin.

"do his"
Isa 1:16-18: Wash you: make you clean; put away the evil of your doings from before my eyes; cease to do evil;
Isa 56:4: For thus says the LORD to the eunuchs that keep my sabbaths: and choose the things that please me: and take hold of my covenant;
Ro 12:2: not be conformed to this world: but be you transformed by the renewing of your mind: that you may prove what is that good: and acceptable: and perfect: will of God.
Col 1:10: That you might walk worthy of the Lord to all pleasing: being fruitful in every good work: and increasing in the knowledge of God;
Heb 13:21: Make you perfect in every good work to do His will: working in you that which is wellpleasing in His sight: through Jesus Christ; to whom be glory for ever and ever. Amen.

"separate"
Ezr 9:1: Now when these things were done: the princes came to me: saying: The people of Israel: and the priests: and the Levites: not have separated themselves from the people of the lands: doing according to their abominations: even of the Canaanites: the Hittites: the Perizzites: the Jebusites: the Ammonites: the Moabites: the Egyptians: and the Amorites.
Ne 13:3: Now it came to pass: when they had heard the law: that they separated from Israel all the mixed multitude.
2Co 6:17: For what reason come out from among them: and be you separate: says the Lord: and not touch the unclean thing; and I will receive you:

"and from the"
De 7:3: 4: Neither will you make marriages with them; your daughter you will not give to his son: nor his daughter will you take to your son.
1Co 2:12-14: Now we have received: not the spirit of the world: but the spirit which is of God; that we might know the things that are freely given to us of God.

12 Then all the congregation answered and said with a loud voice, As you have said, so must we do.Ezra 10:12
Stats
Rank: #4914 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 96 characters, 17 words, 75 letters, 31 vowels, 44 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וַיַּֽעְנ֧וּ כָֽל־הַקָּהָ֛ל וַיֹּאמְר֖וּ קֹ֣ול גָּדֹ֑ול כֵּ֛ן [כְּדִבְרֶיךָ כ] (כִּדְבָרְךָ֥ ק) עָלֵ֖ינוּ לַעֲשֹֽׂות׃

Lit: And answered all the assembly and said with a voice loud Yes as you have said so we must do

KJV: Then all the congregation answered and said with a loud voice, As thou hast said, so must we do.
References

"so must we do"
Ezr 10:3: 4: Now therefore let us make a covenant with our God to put away all the wives: and such as are born of them: according to the counsel of my lord: and of those that tremble at the commandment of our God; and let it be done according to the law.
Ne 13:23: In those days also saw I Jews that had married wives of Ashdod: of Ammon: and of Moab:
Ps 78:37: 57: For their heart not was right with him: neither were they stedfast in his covenant.

 אֲבָ֞ל הָעָ֥ם רָב֙ וְהָעֵ֣ת גְּשָׁמִ֔ים וְאֵ֥ין כֹּ֖חַ לַעֲמֹ֣וד בַּח֑וּץ וְהַמְּלָאכָ֗ה לֹֽא־לְיֹ֤ום אֶחָד֙ וְלֹ֣א לִשְׁנַ֔יִם כִּֽי־הִרְבִּ֥ינוּ לִפְשֹׁ֖עַ בַּדָּבָ֥ר הַזֶּֽה׃

13 But the people are many, and it is a time of much rain, and we not are able to stand without, neither is this a work of one day or two: for we are many that have transgressed in this thing.Ezra 10:13
Stats
Rank: #6826 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 193 characters, 33 words, 144 letters, 57 vowels, 87 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: אֲבָ֞ל הָעָ֥ם רָב֙ וְהָעֵ֣ת גְּשָׁמִ֔ים וְאֵ֥ין כֹּ֖חַ לַעֲמֹ֣וד בַּח֑וּץ וְהַמְּלָאכָ֗ה לֹֽא־לְיֹ֤ום אֶחָד֙ וְלֹ֣א לִשְׁנַ֔יִם כִּֽי־הִרְבִּ֥ינוּ לִפְשֹׁ֖עַ בַּדָּבָ֥ר הַזֶּֽה׃

Lit: But there are people many and it is the season for heavy rain and not we are able to stand outside and the work nor is this of days one or two for there are many of us who have transgressed in matter this

KJV: But the people are many, and [it is] a time of much rain, and we are not able to stand without, neither [is this] a work of one day or two: for we are many that have transgressed in this thing.
References

"the people"
Ezr 10:18-44: Among the sons of the priests there were found that had taken strange wives: namely: of the sons of Jeshua the son of Jozadak: and his brothers; Maaseiah: and Eliezer: and Jarib: and Gedaliah.
Mt 7:13: 14: Enter you in at the strait gate: for wide is the gate: and broad is the way: that leads to destruction: and many there be which go in thereat:

14 Let now our rulers of all the congregation stand, and let all them which have taken strange wives in our cities come at appointed times, and with them the elders of every city, and the judges thereof, until the fierce wrath of our God for this matter be turned from us.Ezra 10:14
Stats
Rank: #5489 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 269 characters, 47 words, 214 letters, 80 vowels, 134 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: יַֽעֲמְדוּ־נָ֣א רֵינוּ לְֽכָל־הַקָּהָ֞ל וְכֹ֣ל ׀ אֲשֶׁ֣ר בֶּעָרֵ֗ינוּ הַהֹשִׁ֞יב נָשִׁ֤ים נָכְרִיֹּות֙ יָבֹא֙ לְעִתִּ֣ים מְזֻמָּנִ֔ים וְעִמָּהֶ֛ם זִקְנֵי־עִ֥יר וָעִ֖יר וְשֹׁפְטֶ֑יהָ עַ֠ד לְהָשִׁ֞יב חֲרֹ֤ון אַף־אֱלֹהֵ֙ינוּ֙ מִמֶּ֔נּוּ עַ֖ד לַדָּבָ֥ר הַזֶּֽה׃ פ

Lit: Let stand please the leaders of entire our assembly and all that in our cities let those who have taken wives pagan come at times appointed and together with the elders of each and their cities and judges of until is turned away fierce the wrath of our God from us even to in matter this

KJV: Let now our rulers of all the congregation stand, and let all them which have taken strange wives in our cities come at appointed times, and with them the elders of every city, and the judges thereof, until the fierce wrath of our God for this matter be turned from us.
References

"our rulers"
De 17:9: 18: 19: you will come to the priests the Levites: and to the judge that will be in those days: and inquire; and they will show you the sentence of judgment:
2Ch 19:5-7: He set judges in the land throughout all the fenced cities of Judah: city by city:

"the fierce"
Nu 25:4: The LORD said to Moses: Take all the heads of the people: and hang them up before the LORD against the sun: that the fierce anger of the LORD may be turned away from Israel.
De 13:17: There will cleave nought of the cursed thing to your hand: that the LORD may turn from the fierceness of His anger: and show you mercy: and have compassion upon you: and multiply you: as He has sworn to your fathers;
Jos 7:26: They raised over Him a great heap of stones to this day. So the LORD turned from the fierceness of His anger. For what reason the name of that place was called: The valley of Achor: to this day.
2Ch 29:10: Now it is in my heart to make a covenant with the LORD God of Israel: that His fierce wrath may turn away from us.
2Ch 30:8: Now be you not stiffnecked: as your fathers were: but yield yourselves to the LORD: and enter into His sanctuary: which He has sanctified for ever: and serve the LORD your God: that the fierceness of His wrath may turn away from you.
Ps 78:38: But he: being full of compassion: forgave their iniquity: and destroyed them not: yes: many a time turned he his anger away: and not did stir up all his wrath.
Isa 12:1: In that day you will say: O LORD: I will praise you: though you were angry with me: your anger is turned away: and you comfortedst me.

15 Only Jonathan the son of Asahel and Jahaziah the son of Tikvah were employed about this matter: and Meshullam and Shabbethai the Levite helped them.Ezra 10:15
Stats
Rank: #7793 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 148 characters, 24 words, 122 letters, 47 vowels, 75 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: אַ֣ךְ יֹונָתָ֧ן בֶּן־עֲשָׂהאֵ֛ל וְיַחְזְיָ֥ה בֶן־תִּקְוָ֖ה עָמְד֣וּ עַל־זֹ֑את וּמְשֻׁלָּ֛ם וְשַׁבְּתַ֥י הַלֵּוִ֖י עֲזָרֻֽם׃

Lit: Only Jonathan son of Asahel and Jahaziah son of Tikvah opposed upon this and Meshullam and Shabbethai the Levite gave them support

KJV: Only Jonathan the son of Asahel and Jahaziah the son of Tikvah were employed about this matter: and Meshullam and Shabbethai the Levite helped them.

16 The children of the captivity did so. And Ezra the priest, with certain chief of the fathers, after the house of their fathers, and all of them by their names, were separated, and sat down in the first day of the tenth month to examine the matter.Ezra 10:16
Stats
Rank: #6009 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 253 characters, 40 words, 197 letters, 71 vowels, 126 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וַיַּֽעֲשׂוּ־כֵן֮ בְּנֵ֣י הַגֹּולָה֒ וַיִּבָּדְלוּ֩ עֶזְרָ֨א הַכֹּהֵ֜ן אֲנָשִׁ֨ים רָאשֵׁ֧י הָאָבֹ֛ות לְבֵ֥ית אֲבֹתָ֖ם וְכֻלָּ֣ם בְּשֵׁמֹ֑ות וַיֵּשְׁב֗וּ בְּיֹ֤ום אֶחָד֙ לַחֹ֣דֶשׁ הָעֲשִׂירִ֔י לְדַרְיֹ֖ושׁ הַדָּבָֽר׃

Lit: And did So the descendants of the captivity and were set apart Ezra the priest with certain heads of the fathers households by the households fathers and each of them by name and they sat down on the day first of the month tenth to examine the matter

KJV: And the children of the captivity did so. And Ezra the priest, with certain chief of the fathers, after the house of their fathers, and all of them by [their] names, were separated, and sat down in the first day of the tenth month to examine the matter.
References

"to examine the matter"
De 13:14: Then will you inquire: and make search: and ask diligently; and: look: if it be truth: and the thing certain: that such abomination is wrought among you;
Job 29:16: I was a father to the poor: and the cause which I not knew I searched out.
Joh 7:51: Does our law judge any man: before it hear him: and know what he does?

Those Guilty of Intermarriage

וַיִּמָּצֵא֙ מִבְּנֵ֣י הַכֹּהֲנִ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר הֹשִׁ֖יבוּ נָשִׁ֣ים נָכְרִיֹּ֑ות מִבְּנֵי֙ יֵשׁ֤וּעַ בֶּן־יֹֽוצָדָק֙ וְאֶחָ֔יו מַֽעֲשֵׂיָה֙ וֶֽאֱלִיעֶ֔זֶר וְיָרִ֖יב וּגְדַלְיָֽה׃

H834אֲשֶׁ֥ר’ă-šer   (Pro-r)
H834 אֲשֶׁר ʼăsher ash-er a primitive relative pronoun (of every gender and number); who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.; idiom after, idiom alike, as (soon as), because, idiom every, for, phrase forasmuch, phrase from whence, phrase how(-soever), idiom if, (so) that ((thing) which, wherein), idiom though, phrase until, phrase whatsoever, when, where (phrase -as, -in, -of, -on, -soever, -with), which, whilst, phrase whither(-soever), who(-m, -soever, -se). As it is indeclinable, it is often accompanied by the personal pronoun expletively, used to show the connection., 		אֲשֶׁ֥ר’ă-šer who Pro-r

18 Among the sons of the priests there were found that had taken strange wives: namely, of the sons of Jeshua the son of Jozadak, and his brothers; Maaseiah, and Eliezer, and Jarib, and Gedaliah.Ezra 10:18
Stats
Rank: #6774 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 196 characters, 28 words, 154 letters, 60 vowels, 94 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וַיִּמָּצֵא֙ מִבְּנֵ֣י הַכֹּהֲנִ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר הֹשִׁ֖יבוּ נָשִׁ֣ים נָכְרִיֹּ֑ות מִבְּנֵי֙ יֵשׁ֤וּעַ בֶּן־יֹֽוצָדָק֙ וְאֶחָ֔יו מַֽעֲשֵׂיָה֙ וֶֽאֱלִיעֶ֔זֶר וְיָרִ֖יב וּגְדַלְיָֽה׃

Lit: And the following were found among the sons of the priests who had taken wives pagan of the sons of Jeshua son of Jozadak and his brothers Maaseiah and Eliezer and Jarib and Gedaliah

KJV: And among the sons of the priests there were found that had taken strange wives: namely, of the sons of Jeshua the son of Jozadak, and his brethren; Maaseiah, and Eliezer, and Jarib, and Gedaliah.
References

"the sons"
Ezr 9:1: Now when these things were done: the princes came to me: saying: The people of Israel: and the priests: and the Levites: not have separated themselves from the people of the lands: doing according to their abominations: even of the Canaanites: the Hittites: the Perizzites: the Jebusites: the Ammonites: the Moabites: the Egyptians: and the Amorites.
Le 21:7: 13-15: They will not take a wife that is a whore: or profane; neither will they take a woman put away from her husband: for He is holy to His God.
1Sa 2:22-24: Now Eli was very old: and heard all that his sons did to all Israel; and how they lay with the women that assembled at the door of the tabernacle of the congregation.
Ne 13:28: one of the sons of Joiada: the son of Eliashib the high priest: was son in law to Sanballat the Horonite: therefore I chased him from me.
Jer 23:11: 14: For both prophet and priest are profane; yes: in my house have I found their wickedness: says the LORD.
Eze 44:22: Neither will they take for their wives a widow: nor her that is put away: but they will take maidens of the seed of the house of Israel: or a widow that had a priest before.
Mal 2:8: 9: But you are departed out of the way; you have caused many to stumble at the law; you have corrupted the covenant of Levi: says the LORD of hosts.
1Ti 3:11: Even so must their wives be grave: not slanderers: sober: faithful in all things.

"Maaseiah"

19 They gave their hands that they would put away their wives; and being guilty, they offered a ram of the flock for their trespass.Ezra 10:19
Stats
Rank: #8641 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 135 characters, 22 words, 106 letters, 37 vowels, 69 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וַיִּתְּנ֥וּ יָדָ֖ם לְהֹוצִ֣יא נְשֵׁיהֶ֑ם וַאֲשֵׁמִ֥ים אֵֽיל־צֹ֖אן עַל־אַשְׁמָתָֽם׃ ס

Lit: And they gave their promise that they would put away their wives and being guilty they presented a ram of the flock as their trespass offering

KJV: And they gave their hands that they would put away their wives; and being guilty, [they offered] a ram of the flock for their trespass.

"gave their hands"

And Jehonadab answered: It is. If it be: give me your hand. And he gave him his hand; and he took him up to him into the chariot.

Ga 2:9: When James: Cephas: and John: who seemed to be pillars: perceived the grace that was given to me: they gave to me and Barnabas the right hands of fellowship; that we should go to the heathen: and they to the circumcision.

"a ram"

Translation

Lit: And of the sons of Immer Hanani and Zebadiah

KJV: And of the sons of Immer; Hanani, and Zebadiah.

 וּמִבְּנֵ֖י חָרִ֑ם מַעֲשֵׂיָ֤ה וְאֵֽלִיָּה֙ וּֽשְׁמַֽעְיָ֔ה וִיחִיאֵ֖ל וְעֻזִיָּֽה׃
StrongsHebrewEnglishMorphology
H1121וּמִבְּנֵ֖יū-mib-bə-nê   (Conj-w, Prep-m | N-mpc)
H1121 בֵּן bên bane from בָּנָה; a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.); phrase afflicted, age, (Ahoh-) (Ammon-) (Hachmon-) (Lev-) ite, (anoint-) ed one, appointed to, (phrase) arrow, (Assyr-) (Babylon-) (Egypt-) (Grec-) ian, one born, bough, branch, breed, phrase (young) bullock, phrase (young) calf, idiom came up in, child, colt, idiom common, idiom corn, daughter, idiom of first, phrase firstborn, foal, phrase very fruitful, phrase postage, idiom in, phrase kid, phrase lamb, (phrase) man, meet, phrase mighty, phrase nephew, old, (phrase) people, phrase rebel, phrase robber, idiom servant born, idiom soldier, son, phrase spark, phrase steward, phrase stranger, idiom surely, them of, phrase tumultuous one, phrase valiant(-est), whelp, worthy, young (one), youth. 		וּמִבְּנֵ֖יū-mib-bə-nê And of the sons Conj-w, Prep-m | N-mpc

H1931ה֣וּאhū   (Pro-3ms)
H1931 הוּא hûwʼ hoo of which the feminine (beyond the Pentateuch) is הִיא; a primitive word, the third person pronoun singular; he (she or it); only expressed when emphatic or without a verb; also (intensively) self, or (especially with the article) the same; sometimes (as demonstrative) this or that; occasionally (instead of copula) as or are; he, as for her, him(-self), it, the same, she (herself), such, that (...it), these, they, this, those, which (is), who., 		ה֣וּאhū he is Pro-3ms

23 Also of the Levites; Jozabad, and Shimei, and Kelaiah, (the same is Kelita,) Pethahiah, Judah, and Eliezer.Ezra 10:23
Stats
Counts: 107 characters, 10 words, 81 letters, 37 vowels, 44 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וּמִֽן־הַלְוִיִּ֑ם יֹוזָבָ֣ד וְשִׁמְעִ֗י וְקֵֽלָיָה֙ ה֣וּא קְלִיטָ֔א פְּתַֽחְיָ֥ה יְהוּדָ֖ה וֶאֱלִיעֶֽזֶר׃ ס

Lit: And of the Levites Jozabad and Shimei and Kelaiah he is Kelita Pethahiah Judah and Eliezer

KJV: Also of the Levites; Jozabad, and Shimei, and Kelaiah, (the same is Kelita,) Pethahiah, Judah, and Eliezer.

"Jozabad"

"Kelita"
Ne 10:10: Their brothers: Shebaniah: Hodijah: Kelita: Pelaiah: Hanan:

וּמִן־הַמְשֹׁרְרִ֖ים אֶלְיָשִׁ֑יב וּמִן־הַשֹּׁ֣עֲרִ֔ים שַׁלֻּ֥ם וָטֶ֖לֶם וְאוּרִֽי׃ ס

H7891 שִׁיר shîyr sheer or (the original form) שׁוּר; (1 Samuel 18:6), a primitive root (rather identical with שׁוּר through the idea of strolling minstrelsy); to sing; behold (by mistake for שׁוּר), sing(-er, -ing man, -ing woman). 		הַמְשֹׁרְרִ֖יםham-šō-rə-rîm of the singers Art | V-Piel-Prtcpl-mp

H2928 טֶלֶם Ṭelem teh-lem from an unused root meaning to break up or treat violently; oppression; Telem, the name of a place in Idumaea, also of a temple doorkeeper; Telem. 		וָטֶ֖לֶםwā-ṭe-lem and Telem Conj-w | N-proper-ms
H221וְאוּרִֽי׃wə-’ū-rî.   (Conj-w | N-proper-ms)
H221 אוּרִי ʼÛwrîy oo-ree from אוּר; fiery; Uri, the name of three Israelites; Uri. 		וְאוּרִֽי׃wə-’ū-rî. and Uri Conj-w | N-proper-ms
24 Of the singers also; Eliashib: and of the porters; Shallum, and Telem, and Uri.Ezra 10:24
Stats
Rank: #6950 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 79 characters, 9 words, 60 letters, 23 vowels, 37 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וּמִן־הַמְשֹׁרְרִ֖ים אֶלְיָשִׁ֑יב וּמִן־הַשֹּׁ֣עֲרִ֔ים שַׁלֻּ֥ם וָטֶ֖לֶם וְאוּרִֽי׃ ס

Lit: And of the singers Eliashib and of the gatekeepers Shallum and Telem and Uri

KJV: Of the singers also; Eliashib: and of the porters; Shallum, and Telem, and Uri.

 וּמִֽיִּשְׂרָאֵ֑ל מִבְּנֵ֣י פַרְעֹ֡שׁ רַ֠מְיָה וְיִזִּיָּ֤ה וּמַלְכִּיָּה֙ וּמִיָּמִ֣ן וְאֶלְעָזָ֔ר וּמַלְכִּיָּ֖ה וּבְנָיָֽה׃ ס

H3478וּמִֽיִּשְׂרָאֵ֑לū-mî-yiś-rā-’êl;   (Conj-w, Prep-m | N-proper-fs)
H3478 יִשְׂרָאֵל Yisrâʼêl yis-raw-ale from שָׂרָה and אֵל; he will rule as God; Jisrael, a symbolical name of Jacob; also (typically) of his posterity; Israel. 		וּמִֽיִּשְׂרָאֵ֑לū-mî-yiś-rā-’êl; And others of Israel Conj-w, Prep-m | N-proper-fs
H1121מִבְּנֵ֣יmib-bə-nê   (Prep-m | N-mpc)
H1121 בֵּן bên bane from בָּנָה; a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.); phrase afflicted, age, (Ahoh-) (Ammon-) (Hachmon-) (Lev-) ite, (anoint-) ed one, appointed to, (phrase) arrow, (Assyr-) (Babylon-) (Egypt-) (Grec-) ian, one born, bough, branch, breed, phrase (young) bullock, phrase (young) calf, idiom came up in, child, colt, idiom common, idiom corn, daughter, idiom of first, phrase firstborn, foal, phrase very fruitful, phrase postage, idiom in, phrase kid, phrase lamb, (phrase) man, meet, phrase mighty, phrase nephew, old, (phrase) people, phrase rebel, phrase robber, idiom servant born, idiom soldier, son, phrase spark, phrase steward, phrase stranger, idiom surely, them of, phrase tumultuous one, phrase valiant(-est), whelp, worthy, young (one), youth. 		מִבְּנֵ֣יmib-bə-nê of the sons Prep-m | N-mpc

25 Moreover of Israel: of the sons of Parosh; Ramiah, and Jeziah, and Malchiah, and Miamin, and Eleazar, and Malchijah, and Benaiah.Ezra 10:25
Stats
Counts: 129 characters, 13 words, 100 letters, 43 vowels, 57 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וּמִֽיִּשְׂרָאֵ֑ל מִבְּנֵ֣י פַרְעֹ֡שׁ רַ֠מְיָה וְיִזִּיָּ֤ה וּמַלְכִּיָּה֙ וּמִיָּמִ֣ן וְאֶלְעָזָ֔ר וּמַלְכִּיָּ֖ה וּבְנָיָֽה׃ ס

Lit: And others of Israel of the sons of Parosh Ramiah and Jeziah and Malchijah and Mijamin and Eleazar and Malchijah and Benaiah

KJV: Moreover of Israel: of the sons of Parosh; Ramiah, and Jeziah, and Malchiah, and Miamin, and Eleazar, and Malchijah, and Benaiah.

H2079 זַבַּי Zabbay zab-bah-ee probably by orthographical error for זַכַּי; Zabbai (or Zaccai), an Israelite; Zabbai. 		זַבַּ֥יzab-bay Zabbai N-proper-ms

 וּמִבְּנֵ֖י בָּנִ֑י מְשֻׁלָּ֤ם מַלּוּךְ֙ וַעֲדָיָ֔ה יָשׁ֖וּב וּשְׁאָ֥ל [יְרֵמֹות כ] (וְרָמֹֽות׃ ק) ס

H1121וּמִבְּנֵ֖יū-mib-bə-nê   (Conj-w, Prep-m | N-mpc)
H1121 בֵּן bên bane from בָּנָה; a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.); phrase afflicted, age, (Ahoh-) (Ammon-) (Hachmon-) (Lev-) ite, (anoint-) ed one, appointed to, (phrase) arrow, (Assyr-) (Babylon-) (Egypt-) (Grec-) ian, one born, bough, branch, breed, phrase (young) bullock, phrase (young) calf, idiom came up in, child, colt, idiom common, idiom corn, daughter, idiom of first, phrase firstborn, foal, phrase very fruitful, phrase postage, idiom in, phrase kid, phrase lamb, (phrase) man, meet, phrase mighty, phrase nephew, old, (phrase) people, phrase rebel, phrase robber, idiom servant born, idiom soldier, son, phrase spark, phrase steward, phrase stranger, idiom surely, them of, phrase tumultuous one, phrase valiant(-est), whelp, worthy, young (one), youth. 		וּמִבְּנֵ֖יū-mib-bə-nê And of the sons Conj-w, Prep-m | N-mpc

 מִבְּנֵ֖י חָשֻׁ֑ם מַתְּנַ֤י מַתַּתָּה֙ זָבָ֣ד אֱלִיפֶ֔לֶט יְרֵמַ֥י מְנַשֶּׁ֖ה שִׁמְעִֽי׃ ס

H1121מִבְּנֵ֖יmib-bə-nê   (Prep-m | N-mpc)
H1121 בֵּן bên bane from בָּנָה; a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.); phrase afflicted, age, (Ahoh-) (Ammon-) (Hachmon-) (Lev-) ite, (anoint-) ed one, appointed to, (phrase) arrow, (Assyr-) (Babylon-) (Egypt-) (Grec-) ian, one born, bough, branch, breed, phrase (young) bullock, phrase (young) calf, idiom came up in, child, colt, idiom common, idiom corn, daughter, idiom of first, phrase firstborn, foal, phrase very fruitful, phrase postage, idiom in, phrase kid, phrase lamb, (phrase) man, meet, phrase mighty, phrase nephew, old, (phrase) people, phrase rebel, phrase robber, idiom servant born, idiom soldier, son, phrase spark, phrase steward, phrase stranger, idiom surely, them of, phrase tumultuous one, phrase valiant(-est), whelp, worthy, young (one), youth. 		מִבְּנֵ֖יmib-bə-nê Of the sons Prep-m | N-mpc
H2828חָשֻׁ֑םḥā-šum;   (N-proper-ms)
H2828 חָשֻׁם Châshum khaw-shoom from the same as חַשְׁמַן; enriched; Chashum, the name of two or three Israelites; Hashum. 		חָשֻׁ֑םḥā-šum; of Hashum N-proper-ms

33 Of the sons of Hashum; Mattenai, Mattathah, Zabad, Eliphelet, Jeremai, Manasseh, and Shimei.Ezra 10:33
Stats
Counts: 92 characters, 6 words, 72 letters, 30 vowels, 42 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: מִבְּנֵ֖י חָשֻׁ֑ם מַתְּנַ֤י מַתַּתָּה֙ זָבָ֣ד אֱלִיפֶ֔לֶט יְרֵמַ֥י מְנַשֶּׁ֖ה שִׁמְעִֽי׃ ס

Lit: Of the sons of Hashum Mattenai Mattattah Zabad Eliphelet Jeremai Manasseh and Shimei

KJV: Of the sons of Hashum; Mattenai, Mattathah, Zabad, Eliphelet, Jeremai, Manasseh, and Shimei.
References

"Hashum"

Ne 7:22: The children of Hashum: 328.

H7967שַׁלּ֥וּםšal-lūm   (N-proper-ms)

H568אֲמַרְיָ֖ה’ă-mar-yāh   (N-proper-ms)
H568 אֲמַרְיָה ʼĂmaryâh am-ar-yaw or prolonged אֲמַרְיָהוּ; from אָמַר and יָהּ; Jah has said (i.e. promised); Amarjah, the name of nine Israelites; Amariah. 		אֲמַרְיָ֖ה’ă-mar-yāh Amariah N-proper-ms
H3130יוֹסֵֽף׃yō-w-sêp̄.   (N-proper-ms)
H3130 יוֹסֵף Yôwçêph yo-safe future of יָסַף; let him add (or perhaps simply active participle adding); Joseph, the name of seven Israelites; Joseph. Compare יְהוֹסֵף. 		יוֹסֵֽף׃yō-w-sêp̄. and Joseph N-proper-ms

Translation
Hebrew: שַׁלּ֥וּם אֲמַרְיָ֖ה יֹוסֵֽף׃ ס

Lit: Shallum Amariah and Joseph

KJV: Shallum, Amariah, and Joseph.

 מִבְּנֵ֖י נְבֹ֑ו יְעִיאֵ֤ל מַתִּתְיָה֙ זָבָ֣ד זְבִינָ֔א [יַדֹּו כ] (יַדַּ֥י ק) וְיֹואֵ֖ל בְּנָיָֽה׃
StrongsHebrewEnglishMorphology
H1121מִבְּנֵ֖יmib-bə-nê   (Prep-m | N-mpc)
H1121 בֵּן bên bane from בָּנָה; a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.); phrase afflicted, age, (Ahoh-) (Ammon-) (Hachmon-) (Lev-) ite, (anoint-) ed one, appointed to, (phrase) arrow, (Assyr-) (Babylon-) (Egypt-) (Grec-) ian, one born, bough, branch, breed, phrase (young) bullock, phrase (young) calf, idiom came up in, child, colt, idiom common, idiom corn, daughter, idiom of first, phrase firstborn, foal, phrase very fruitful, phrase postage, idiom in, phrase kid, phrase lamb, (phrase) man, meet, phrase mighty, phrase nephew, old, (phrase) people, phrase rebel, phrase robber, idiom servant born, idiom soldier, son, phrase spark, phrase steward, phrase stranger, idiom surely, them of, phrase tumultuous one, phrase valiant(-est), whelp, worthy, young (one), youth. 		מִבְּנֵ֖יmib-bə-nê Of the sons Prep-m | N-mpc

43 Of the sons of Nebo; Jeiel, Mattithiah, Zabad, Zebina, Jadau, and Joel, Benaiah.Ezra 10:43
Stats
Counts: 80 characters, 6 words, 60 letters, 28 vowels, 32 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: מִבְּנֵ֖י נְבֹ֑ו יְעִיאֵ֤ל מַתִּתְיָה֙ זָבָ֣ד זְבִינָ֔א [יַדֹּו כ] (יַדַּ֥י ק) וְיֹואֵ֖ל בְּנָיָֽה׃

Lit: Of the sons of Nebo Jeiel Mattithiah Zabad Zebina Iddo Jaddai and Joel and Benaiah

KJV: Of the sons of Nebo; Jeiel, Mattithiah, Zabad, Zebina, Jadau, and Joel, Benaiah.
References

"Nebo"
Ezr 2:29: The children of Nebo: 52.
Ne 7:33: The men of the other Nebo: 52.

 כָּל־אֵ֕לֶּה [נָשְׂאוּ כ] (נָשְׂא֖וּ ק) נָשִׁ֣ים נָכְרִיֹּ֑ות וְיֵ֣שׁ מֵהֶ֣ם נָשִׁ֔ים וַיָּשִׂ֖ימוּ בָּנִֽים׃ פ

H3605כָּל־kāl-   (N-msc)
H3605 כֹּל kôl kole or (Jeremiah 33:8) כּוֹל; from כָּלַל; properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense); (in) all (manner, (ye)), altogether, any (manner), enough, every (one, place, thing), howsoever, as many as, (no-) thing, ought, whatsoever, (the) whole, whoso(-ever). 		כָּל־kāl- All N-msc

H5375(נָשְׂא֖וּ)(nā-śə-’ū   (V-Qal-Perf-3cp)
H5375 נָשָׂא nâsâʼ naw-saw or נָסָה; (Psalm 4:6 (אֲבַד)), a primitive root; to lift, in a great variety of applications, literal and figurative, absolute and relative; accept, advance, arise, (able to, (armor), suffer to) bear(-er, up), bring (forth), burn, carry (away), cast, contain, desire, ease, exact, exalt (self), extol, fetch, forgive, furnish, further, give, go on, help, high, hold up, honorable (phrase man), lade, lay, lift (self) up, lofty, marry, magnify, idiom needs, obtain, pardon, raise (up), receive, regard, respect, set (up), spare, stir up, phrase swear, take (away, up), idiom utterly, wear, yield. H802נָשִׁ֣יםnā-šîm   (N-fp)
H802 אִשָּׁה ʼishshâh ish-shaw feminine of אִישׁ or אֱנוֹשׁ; irregular plural, נָשִׁים;(used in the same wide sense as אֱנוֹשׁ); a woman; (adulter) ess, each, every, female, idiom many, phrase none, one, phrase together, wife, woman. Often unexpressed in English. 		נָשִׁ֣יםnā-šîm wives N-fp

H1121בָּנִֽים׃bā-nîm.   (N-mp)
H1121 בֵּן bên bane from בָּנָה; a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.); phrase afflicted, age, (Ahoh-) (Ammon-) (Hachmon-) (Lev-) ite, (anoint-) ed one, appointed to, (phrase) arrow, (Assyr-) (Babylon-) (Egypt-) (Grec-) ian, one born, bough, branch, breed, phrase (young) bullock, phrase (young) calf, idiom came up in, child, colt, idiom common, idiom corn, daughter, idiom of first, phrase firstborn, foal, phrase very fruitful, phrase postage, idiom in, phrase kid, phrase lamb, (phrase) man, meet, phrase mighty, phrase nephew, old, (phrase) people, phrase rebel, phrase robber, idiom servant born, idiom soldier, son, phrase spark, phrase steward, phrase stranger, idiom surely, them of, phrase tumultuous one, phrase valiant(-est), whelp, worthy, young (one), youth. 		בָּנִֽים׃bā-nîm. children N-mp
44 All these had taken strange wives: and some of them had wives by whom they had children.Ezra 10:44
Stats
Counts: 88 characters, 16 words, 70 letters, 23 vowels, 47 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: כָּל־אֵ֕לֶּה [נָשְׂאוּ כ] (נָשְׂא֖וּ ק) נָשִׁ֣ים נָכְרִיֹּ֑ות וְיֵ֣שׁ מֵהֶ֣ם נָשִׁ֔ים וַיָּשִׂ֖ימוּ בָּנִֽים׃ פ

Lit: All these had taken wives pagan and had some of them wives and by whom they had children

KJV: All these had taken strange wives: and some of them had wives by whom they had children.
References

"strange wives"
Pr 2:16: To deliver you from the strange woman: even from the stranger which flatters with her words;
Pr 5:3: 20: For the lips of a strange woman drop as an honeycomb: and her mouth is smoother than oil:
